If you have the time on your trip, this is a beautiful venue to enjoy. Its scenic and you can get in lots of walking also! Few carts are sometimes around to snack or get some coffee if you didnt carry a picnic bag.
I see TripAdvisor still won't let me add photos without writing a review. It's a nice enough park; not the best you'll ever go to, and fairly quiet, but good for a pleasant green walk around.
A lovely park to walk around, the fall colours were really nice. There are nice things to photograph too, a few bridges, the windmill, the castle, etc.
We really enjoyed our wander around the park, which looks fantastic in Autumn. Very relaxing and enjoyable wander. Pond with ducks, nice ambience - recommended for a stroll.
A beautiful park, there are graveyards in it, lots of people around the park. Well worth a visit. lots of water features and there is a lovely wind mill and castle in the park also
A nice park for relax and good to spend time with family, especially with children. Luck for me I had a good weather..
It's a great way to spend an afternoon, strolling by the lakes and streams that dot this picturesque garden.
Nice little spot in the center of city. Quiet with room for picnics or just a place to go for a short walk.
Extremely good coffee with kind and professional staff - very cheap and good compared to others . You find Express Kaffe in Facebook and Instagram and they are often in this park next to the Fontaine
Nice place to meet friends for a light lunch and a beautiful garden. Very good food and hospitality .
The park is huge and we walked 2 hours through it, at the weekend you see many locals here. People feeding ducks and doing sport. It's really well kept and clean.

Swedish people loves natures and you may see it even in the very center of their cities. Kungsparken with its old trees and channel is the perfect place to take a walk to enjoy quietness away from the worries of the world. The park is a very safe place. At the channel and ponds

Very nice park, clean with plenty of paths and well maintained. We spent an hour or two here the day we went to Malmo. The weather played ball and it was pleasant and not too hot, with a nice amount of sun out. In this type of weather it is fantastic and there is a nice outdoor

Very nice park. Feels a bit wild and unkempt for the King's park. I didn't appreciate how many people were riding bicycles inside the park when this was forbidden. Not a judgement against the park. Definitely recommend this place to walk through on a nice day.
If the weather is good just have a walk and a lunch in the open door restaurant, this is a very good place in Malmö to enjoy a sunny day. Close to the museums as well.
lovely garden in the mid of the city , it had the little walk with huge trees on both sides which i enjoyed alot and took some decent pictures
We had a great family picnic, fed the ducks, played on the playground equipment, and had some excellent coffee from a nice kiosk. A great afternoon in Malmo!
What can I say, just a really nice Park in the centre of town. Luckily we visited on a nice sunny day, with lots going on, but still very relaxing. Well worth a visit.
This is a very nice park in central Malmo, with a moat allowing for boat rides and an organic garden and cafe. A pleasant green spot in the middle of town
This park is well maintained and is a must visit with family and friends. Relax in the park, take a stroll, enjoy the serene beauty of the lake and the birds. Mine was a calm and soothing experience.
The park is very scenic with plenty of botanical sites, a museum/castle, and a windmill. Not large, but very popular.

I could have happily spent hours wandering this park. At one point there was a beautiful path that made me feel like I was walking through a cathedral made of trees. It isn't flooded by city noises, and is a nice escape.

One of the big park in Malmö also known as City of parks, with lake and city Canal flowing through it. You can hire a padal boat nearby and paddel through it. It also accomodates city library , Malmö Casino and a restaurant. There is also a play area for small visitors. On the

Lots of beautiful massive trees, with the river winding throughout, these gardens are gorgeous. There are plenty of paths to choose from and several bridges so you can meander at will. Also very worthwhile is the Slottstradgarden, an organic vegetable garden managed by the city.

If you enjoy to make a walk in the midst of a large city like Malmö, and get away from the traffic noise or just not see any cars, but enjoy walk amongst other people looking at the scenery, birds, houses etc, then this park is for you. We enjoyed a walk through the park,

Extremely romantic park located at Malmo city center - filled with lakes , flowers , bridges. There is an amazing cafe there - you sit right at the place where locals can come and plant their flowers and veggies. Btw - the best shrimp sandwich I ever tried !!!!
Such a nice, peaceful, quiet area for a walk in the summer. If we had known better, we would have brought a small picnic as this would be a great place to enjoy it.
An attractive park with very impressive glass houses. Get a drink and a snack from the converted Citroen van stood in the terrace.

It's a very beautiful park right in the middle of the city. When I visited the city it was an awful rainy day so I couldn't appreaciate this park, I only went there and walk it through but I wish I could have spent more time there enjoying the nature and relaxing. You know

Beautiful calm quiet orderly gardens. Worth going out of your way for. We wandered in here by mistake on our way home and left there two hours later feeling peaceful and rested. The gardens are beautiful. There is a very special little herb garden which is neatly labeled
Lovely park in center of Malmoe. With water, bridges and a lot of spots to seat and relax on. Fantastic views.

This park is oldest park in Malmo. It has got a large number of exotic trees, numerous paths, lined with the trees, number of canals and other waters, also for the visitors, the walking trails. There are also some interesting sculptures, the fountains. Liked a much to have some
This park is very nice. There are wide walking trails. There is canals and some other water. The paths are tree lined. I enjoyed walking the park very much.

Pleasant park to wonder around if you have time to spare while in Malmo. Well tended with some interesting sculptures. Full of joggers and families walking. A river runs through it and attracts lots of water birds.
Fatastic nature. Very good place to walking in for a couples hand in hand. Also for a Nice picknick in the green garden

Kungsparken, the Kingspark. Take a walk around this park wich is in fact two parks, it is kind of hard to see were the Castle park begin. I recomend though to rent a pedalboat and take the canal entrance to this oasis. You will find a great cafe/ restaurant in the park and

Kungsparken and Slottsparken are divided by a canal but are really one park. A beautiful well kept romantic area in the city. Perfekt for strolling, jogging or having a picknick. There also is a very nice and popular outdoor café and lunch restaurant in the vegetable and flower
With the well maintained gardens. Cafe tucked away in lovely location. Windmill, ducks and places to sit. Take the time to enjoy life.

I really love how it is connected with Slottsparken and Slottsträdgården, making it such a huge area to walk in. And I especially love the peace and quiet atmosphere, beautiful nature, and the cleanliness there. I've been visiting Kungsparken for at least 15 times in less than a

Took a day trip to Malmo from Copenhagen and took the time to walk through this park. It's very pretty with beautiful trees, bridges and water. There are plenty of benches where you can sit through-out, which is nice. Definitely worth a stroll through ...

This place is worth a visit if you're looking for a calm space away from the tourist attractions in the city. Plenty of trails to walk through. There's a giant old fashioned will mill and adjacent to it is a garden with various themes.
Great walking paths, excellent gardens (small botanical plots, many are themed). Shady and peaceful. Nice little cafe.
Nice to see. Good for child and dogs. Fresh, relaxable and peacefull place. One of the place you have to visit in Malmö
Wonderful art, flowers, and trees all over this centrally located park. Lots of benches to take a break or picnic.
Nice place to visit for a walk, a run or a picnic. Full of people , especially when it's sunny. Recommend only if the weather is nice.
beautiful gardens,peace and quiet in the city. A perfect place to relax. You can walk,run cycle ,have a pic nic. What else can anyone ask for?
Definitely, This park is one of the most beautiful park that I've seen in my life. Great landscape, quiet environment, best place for relaxing and breathing the fresh air!

A beautiful park, so tranquil, so relaxing. We were here for a few hours because we came from Copenhagen for an afternoon but I wanted to stay all day. Just sit down on the grass and relax or go around with the little boats. We will definitely come back.

Kungsparken is a nice park, centrally located and walking distance from the central station. We first ate a burger at the Tommy's burger joint which is located close to the casino in the park and then went out for a stroll in the sun. The final boat tour through the canal was
direct in the city the Kungsparken is a place to relax. In between the waters many small areas offer lots of diferent perspectives to the nature. great place to come down.

We visited the park on a day trip to malmo on a sunny Saturday. It's a pleasant, peaceful place and was the perfect spot to sit back and enjoy people / duck watching. Had we had more time we would have loved to have hired a boat to explore the waterways. Well worth a visit.
Nice areas to walk or picnic in , statues hidden, gardens in themes around the world , water ways ponds across middle , castle on one side too and great cafe just on edge near old trams
Wow, the gang & I went here yes and we were just stunned by the magnificence of this beautiful park. I could walk through here every day if I wouldn't live basically a whole country away.
This is one of our big and nice park to visit and you have to do it when you visit Malmö. Here you can have picnic or go to one of the restaurants . Really beutiful place.

A big park with many peaceful moments for you to chare. Sit by the water, feel the peace and calm or just watch the runners next to you. But beware from all the ducks that migh find you interesting if you have any kind of food :).
If the sun is shining get down here beautiful trees and beautiful flowers. You can bike there or walk

Very beautiful park. Spent a day in Malmo while visiting Copenhagen (if you visit, bring your passport as it was checked on the train). Walked to this park and felt it was a beautiful site. Not completely in bloom yet, but still beautiful. Could have spent the whole afternoon

After a couple of hours biking around Malmo we found ourselves in Kungsparken- it's beautiful! Some lovely lakes, sculptures and interesting hardens make this a really lovely spot for a walk or to bike around.
Extensive interconnected parks across the city with waterways, cycleways and lots of green space. Made my day to see such brilliant town planning and desperate to return to Sweden again.
I so enjoyed this peaceful haven in the centre of the city. I enjoyed the gardens planted and cared for by local people and make sure you visit the cafe and have a bowl of soup in the greenhouse!

A beautiful park, where you can enjoy the nature (trees, the river, Ducks and swans!!!!) You can enjoy your walk with friends or family, ride a bicycle, lie by the river and enjoy the sound of the ducks and swans.
Beautiful daffodils and small blue flowers, nice for a walk, quiet and relaxing, nice mill and castle. Bring the kids for a picnic or juat go there to clear your head away from the traffic.
A must do in Malmö. Beautiful garden. 10min walking from the central train station of Malmö. Very nice place to visit

Great place with little garden in the middle and plenty of different species of flowers. On one part there is windmill with such amazing garden and feeling around. In the middle you can find a pond with some statue of guy following goose's.
A lot of places to take a brake, drink some coffee on blanket while reading a good book (the library is close by). During winter good for a brisk walk.
Even in the wintertime this place is stunning. With snow all over this place seems like a fairy tale. So relaxing for mind and body. A must visit.......
Nice park in the city of Malmo. A pound and many nice birds. Perfect area for a nice walk any time of the year.

This park at the back of the castle is very scenic and has good walking paths. There are various things to see from wildlife, lakes, windmills and statues. A nice scenic diversion and connection between the old town and the castle/transport museum.

Kungsparken translated The Kings Park certainly is beautiful. Not a massive park, you can cover this and enjoy this and other sights in one day. The old transport canals wind the park giving it depth and charm. There are grass areas, play parks for kids, a cafe, and a lake. The
I spent a really nice time walking this park and people watching. It is a very good place to relax or picnic in on your way to see Malmo Castle.
An huge green area near city center. It's a nice place to visit and relax, have a brea, read or just feel the powerful energy of nature in our mind.

If you find yourself tired of the stress in the city and the feeling of concrete is getting to you, you need to take a long walk in Kungsparken. It's green and with the beautiful calmnes of water flowing through. Kungsparken is one of two adjacent parks a few steps from the
Even during winter time (when it's not so green) it's necessary to visit this park if you like fairy tales :)
Very nice place, beautiful lake with ducks, birds and swans. Its quiet, clean and very green. The old Windmill was really great. Its a must see in Malmo, we would recommend!!
I thought this park was nicer than the others. Not so huge but very well kept, with nice gardens and trails to walk/run around.

It was freezing cold and hardly anyone was at the park. We noticed the park on a previous visit to Malmö castle the previous day . It was a nice place to run , I'm sure it a nicer place in warmer weather.
Great place to spend some family time. Lot of diferent activitys inside. Just take walk and you are going to have a lot of fun.

Having arrived in Malmo just to say I spent a day in Sweden I meandered about to King's Park. I figured it would just be a large green space as most parks are, but really, it's more than that. The lovely covered walks throughout the park were nice on the warm day, and there
Not as big as one would expect but a lovely spot for a sandwich at lunchtime. Otherwise just like any other City Park.
St Paoili Church, under repair but striking outer view. This park breaks the monotony of the built-up area and is an alternative passage, green and relaxing, through this part of Malmo.
A nice park for a stroll around the channel. You can go to Malmo city garden and it is always colorful to go there. There are some restaurants there but I am not sure they are open year round.

A lovely park. In reality the Slottsparken and this one are actually one and the same, even though (perhaps for administrative reasons) they have different names. The cafe by the greenhouses was closed when we visited on a late October lunchtime. If you need toilets they are by

This beautiful park is well worth a visit if you visit Malmo. We visited in autumn and the colours of the leaves were very attractive. There were interesting sculptures to look at and a bridge through the park. We walked from the park to the centre of Malmo. There is a great
It was very very beautiful specially in autumn.yelliw and red and orange and green colors.lakes and birds.I loved it.you should go if you visit malmo
Small playground area but a beautiful park in Malmö. Apparently this is the city of parks:) and this is one if many. Beautiful location on the canal.

This is probably one of my favorite parks in the world. It is so lovely-- the giant old trees, the beautiful lake with all the different ducks and swans, the garden with its compost heap and windmill. A wonderful place for a stroll, a jog, a picnic, or simply to sit with a book.
Nice park emerging from Slottstradgarden. A perfect place for walking, jogging and going out with the kids.

this is the Swedish central park...but it is only one of several in Malmo. wonder place to walk..and get a feel for the life of the city. Swedes ride bikes every where so you will see families, business people and dogs going thru the park.
It is a quiet and green park for a meditating walk. You can see people jogging, children playing. You can also reach the Malmö House by walking through the park.

In my first day in Malmo I visited this park to get some relaxation after a stressful week in my home town . The view there wss wonderful . Although it was saturday but it wasn't crowded and I could get some peaceful and relaxing time . I didn't have time to walk all through it

Not too far from the train station and a great place to pack a picnic on a nice day. We did the canal tour and then circled through the park to see the windmill and castle before getting lunch and heading back to the drain on our day trip from Copenhagen

Unfortunately, on our daytrip to Malmo we had all too little time to explore the park. But it provided a beautiful 'nature break' during our visit to Malmo and Malmohus Slott. My daughter, wife, and mother-in-law birded while the rest of us wandered about and took in the sights.
Being in Malmo you need to take a walk to this park. It's very peaceful with couple of suprises like Fontaine, bridges, old Mill. ..
This park is great for a walk or a jog in the city. Also if you want to have a picnic, it is great for that also.

Took a lovely walk here with my husband and baby. Beautiful park for a nice walk. Very quiet. Not much to do there so if you're hoping for lunch you might want to bring it with you. Peaceful little spot in the city. Lovely.
Very pleasant place to walk in the centre of the city. Must have been an old church yard because there are graves in one part
Walking through this park took my breath away. It was so beautiful and peaceful and made my experience to Malmo truly memorable.
Centrally located park that is nice for a leisurely walk around to get out of the city and feel the fresh green of the outdoors.
A beautiful Park located centrally. Perfect for a stroll or easy jog. Look out for the bunny's and make a picnic under a tree
This is a very peaceful place,to rest your weary legs before resuming your walk about town. Very close to the Malmohus Museum.

very close to the city center so touring folks can easily access this park. much like the parks in Copenhagen (just across the water about 15 miles away) this one is beautifully maintained. worth going to just to relax, watch the ducks and swans, and enjoy the sun.

Kungsparken is the biggest and most wonderful park in Malmö. A visit is highly advisable especially in the summer-autumn seasons, although my favourite was AUTUMN! Amazing feel when colourful leaves falling down the ground, lovely!

We really didn't know what to expect in Malmo, but we wanted to take the train over from Copenhagen just to say we'd been to Sweden. But Malmo was great, and we wandered into this fantastic garden and really enjoyed it. Lots of birds, lots of blooms, lots of butterflies. My
Lovely walking through the park to explore, especially on a crisp winters day. Also had outside toilets along the way which came in handy for a pregnant lady!
So much to see in Kungsparken. Fabulous flowers. Lovely Lakes. Splendid statues. Allow plenty of time to visit here, And bring your camera
We walked down here from the train station. It was a sunny day and a lot of people were about enjoying the day and the park. It's green with a lot of trees and water. Nice place to relax.
This is the most beautiful park in Malmö! Definitely a go to place in the summer. Its also close to the well preserved windmill as well as Slottsträdgården which is beautiful in the summer!

I zigzagged through part of the park, during my early morning run. Nice settings with bridges, small lakes, flower gardens, an old mill and Malmø Castle. When I walked through same afternoon, the parks was bustling with life. Great place for relaxing.
My number one thing about Malmo - a lovely, quiet, free park with good views of the Turning Torso, a nice café, a windmill etc. Spent an enjoyable hour here.
I missed a little bit of effort from the city government in terms of landscaping but some fun activities and festivals happen there, it's quiet, and safe...like anything Swedish!
Nice park for spending free time in Malmo, and even best for relax and enjoy nice and calm atmosphere
spend few hours in this park, offer a nice view to lakes and flowers , ideal place for family outing where you can cook and do chit chat

This park is a must if you go to Malmo. It is near the centre and full of beautiful landscapes. There are bridges, lakes, canals, big old trees, fountains, lots of birds (the ducks are the cutest ever), little rabbits, everything. 😍 There is also a windmill and you can see the

Spent some time wandering around here while waiting for the ferry. Certainly a lovely park for a walk and the ducks and fish were very entertaining. Nice little cafe at one point although the queue was quite long.

What a wonderful place to take a stroll in Malmo. We sat by the lake, watched the ducks, walked some more, sat in the grass and sun. The flowers were amazing - so much color and variety. Highly recommend.

It is hard to add to the good reviews already submitted here. The park is just stunning a beautiful green peaceful space, it has everything such a park should have. Fabulous trees, water, swans and ducks. The landscaping and bridges are lovely and a new vista at every turn.
They have plenty of rabbits running around! It has nice walkways, perfect for exercise or family walk. There's a river, some old trees that make perfect background for family photos
Nice to have access to such a place so close to the city. Looks to be used for a lot of recreation and relaxing.
Nice park in the centre of Malmö - seemed to be a cute outdoor cafe in the middle of it. Windmill was really pretty and worth a look.
A nice park on a sunny day located not too far from city centre... Look for the art gallery located in an old water tower.
Nice green space between the museums and the city centre. You can walk, jog, run or cycle around or through it. And it's free!

Yeah totally nice park and that. Loads of trees and a lake or river or something. Kids parks, sculptures, fountains, all stuff like that. Saw a red squirrel too. Or was that in the zoo in Copemhagen? No, I think it was in Kungsparken. If you are in the area, pop in. Don't plane

The park is perfect for a picnic or exploring the many paths leading to gardens, water features, statues or the canal. Kungsparken is a great 'time out' from a busy schedule. There are plenty of spaces to sit and watch the birds or the water. Lovely escape in the city.

It's not a very large park, but there seemed to be a beautiful view, or something new around every corner. Definitely worth a walk through! Plus we walked through a designer photo shoot.. So who knows you might run into someone or something very cool!
Malmo has several beautiful parks where you can enjoy nature, take a deep breath and forget about everything else.

We walked around this park, admiring the gardens and the birds. There were swans, other unique birds and their babies. The park was filled with joggers, cyclists, and those on picnics. There are many trees so there is no lack of shade. Make your way over to Malmohus and admire

Spent a good few hours walking round the park. There was a lovely garden area where people were planting and growing flowers which was beautiful. There is a large central lake which has a host of wildlife and birds, which was lovely to walk around. Also there is a big windmill

we spent hours in this park on our visit to Malmö. we took a picnic blanket and bought some food on the walk there from central station and had a really nice lunch sitting near the dog statue (which my 2 year old absolutely loved! who knew a statue could provide so much peace
A nice palace just to walk next to down town. I guess all seasons bring its own beauty in different weather conditions - providing you have the right clothing
We enjoyed our stroll through the shade of the trees in the Kings Park. A great escape from the very warm sun.
Is great to have a place like this in the middle od a big town like Malmö. Lovly nature. Just beautyfull

When the weather is nice, this is the place in Malmö to enjoy nature, although the park is situated near the city centre. In late spring, when we went, loads of flowers in bloom (chestnut, jasmin, wood hyacinths...) which adds nice aroma´s to the visit.
a beautiful park with lots of space but also lots of hide aways too. Very good for spending time relaxing and watching the world go by. very clean and tidy.
If you want to do a long distance run, this is not the place, but it's a great place for a little holiday exercise. A picnic there could also be very nice.
Well laid out - with a working windmill, this very attractive park has pretty gardens as well as plenty of space for other activities and a canal - well worth a stroll around
It was very clean and I felt safe all the time. There is big variety of birds - swans, ducks, ravens, seagulls, etc.
Sweden has lots of green oasis in Malmo, and every one of them is worth seeing. Ideal place for running! Try it and breathe!!

We were lucky our day trip to Malmö was on a sunny day so we had a walk around this park. The pathways were clean and it was a pleasant walk with several artworks to see along the way. Watch out for the hungry ducks if you bring a snack!

Spring must be the best time to walk in this park, the leaves are new, and many trees are blossoming. There is a particularly beautiful avenue of trees, and the water in the canal/lake system seemed clean. Well set out with cycle and walkways and areas to picnic. Loved the
If the weather is good this is an ideal place to visit. Popular with the locals. Takes about 20 minutes to walk through.
Enjoyable nice park in the heart of Malmö with a lot of old tries and fresh air. Just perfect for running, walking, spending time.

On a short stopover in Malmo we visited the Kungsparken gardens. Situated on the west side of the town, these beautifully maintained gardens provide a peaceful setting for a gentle walk. The gardens are laced with waterways which are particularly popular with the local ducks
Beautiful park with lovely manicured gardens. There is a nice lake with ducks and geese. Lovely windmill and walled garden. Good children's play area. We would recommend
located close to city center, it's a very pleasant place to walk around and enjoy nature when the weather are suitable.

We walked around the park area for about one hour. It seemed to have many natural resources including a little system of canals. Trust that the best time of year to visit the place is late spring and summer, and we were to early. We may try it next time in summer time, to enjoy
A really nice and relaxing quiet park. Nice place to be to chill for a while. Lots of green space and close to the city centre

We were only here for a day trip so after walking through the town we took a turn about the park. Very pleasant with waterside walks. You can see the windmill easily and have good vies of the Turning Torso. We followed the waterway back to the station. This town has some great

Walking from the old churchyard in the inner part of Malmö - to the Kungsparken bring you close to the Casino, an old windmill and the backside of the Malmö Castle. Even the City Library is located in the area. To be recommended to stroll around and feeding the birds...
A bike through the Park every day on my way to work. It is so calm, beautiful and tranquil to stroll around or just pass through. Cannot but recommend!
Malmo is a city with fantastic parks. This is one of them. If you visit, make sure is during spring or summer for a walk, picnic, take the kids to see some ducks.
Malmö or should I say sweden has amazing parks that is always buzzing in the summer months but avoid the streets nearby when the students celebrate graduation around June

Malmo is generally so much more attractive than certain TV shows suggest, and this park proves it. Right in the middle of the city, it was a lovely place to walk around and have a picnic lunch - by far the cheapest way to eat in Malmo!
This is a nice park for having picknick or just reading a book. A perfekt place for taking a walk, its a green and beautiful park.
The park is very nice for walking in a large green area in the middle of the city. Close the rest of the main attrsactions of the city.
Close to the library. This park is beautiful, with different landscapes. you can make excercise, or read, or have a nice picnic. You can even have a photo session with your loved ones
Nice park is very close to city center with ponds and a lot of wild geese. Nice view for Turning Torso from the park.
Great park, especially during spring it is definetely worth walking around. once you exit, you immediately find yourself in the middle of the city.
My friend and childhood friend had there weeding here. average park hard to find car park. Some statues aswell and dam.
A large park which includes the Malmohus Slott (castle) is nice to walk through. You could take a different path each time and have a lovely time.
There is so many nice places in this park. A lot of water, and old windmill, nice view over the Turning Torso. In summer there is an open restaurant and some flower gardens.

Two wonderful parks in one Enjoy to large parks in the city center of Malmö, to walk run and relax in, during the spring and summer green and full of flowers. Do not miss the café in the middle of the park well known from Swedish television or at least some of chiefs.

I was cycling and wanted to have a walk through Kungsparken. Young children from the local kindergarten were there with their teachers and I was very impressed to see h ow the children are well equipped in their snowsuits for the cold weather. Delightful to walk through and very

A surprisingly large park in the centre of Malmo, this is a good spot to relax and wander. There are gardens, flowers, conservatories to visit and interesting artwork and fountains. Well worth finding a spot for lunch to relax.

This is the most beautiful park in Malmö. It's not very large, but it's English, full of flowers in spring, romantic, lush and absolutely beautiful. Everybody's happy here: the Young, the lovers, the dogowners, the elderly. Try it in May. The stuff of dreams.

We were there in light rain and still enjoyed the park. The trees lining the paths kept the rain off nicely. Be sure to see the slightly weird statue Diana near Slottsgatan. Near the windmill is a series of gorgeous gardens - including cacti - that were still in bloom in early
See the bomb that didn't explode, the mini gardens, watch the, water fowl, take in the wind mill and Malmo House aka Malmo Castle. We started our walking tour here.

A great place to go for a relaxing walk, cycle or just sit quietly and meditate. The park is well-maintained, clean and peaceful. A nice place to bring the kids too. From this park you can get a view of the famous Turning Torso and at the end of the walk you will eventually
It was very relaxing to have a walk and a snack in...with swans and chirpy birds. The trees gave a good shade from the summer sun.
Great landscapes and flowers. You can see a windmill, also ypu can see it from the inside and learn about it's history.
Built back in the 1800s and is Malmö's oldest park. The park is very romantic and it is noticeable that it inspired many of Europe's parks.A nice walk all seasons
Went to Malmo to seen the twisting torso and the park. Enjoyed the stay here and relaxed in the clean park. It also has museums and castles nearby. Get a one day pass for city travel.
Very lovely park. There was hundreds of different kinds of trees and a lot of native wildlife. It's a beautiful place for a walk, and a must-see in Malmo.
Beautiful grounds and a lovely area to walk through near the city centre. Nice water features. Well tended and clean.

Lovely surroundings in the middle of the city. Here you can walk, take a run or take a ride with the gondola (funny but true, it is a real gondola!) on the river. It is clean, full of flowers. Benches everywhere, play ground for children and Malmö casino is also in the park.

Kungspark is park with a lot rivers/streams, nice bridges and places for rest. For me were especially these many streams together with bridges very special. I think, that this place is not only for parents with their kids, but for youngsters as well. Beautiful place with calmer
A very nice park that is definitely worth a walk around on a nice day. Not a bad way to spend some time if you've got an hour before a train or something similar.
Had a walk through the park on a sunny September day. Would recommend if in Malmö and the weather is decent.
Had a great picnic here in a quiet waterside place....Very peaceful. Great park for getting your exercise in - walking/jogging trails are varied and not congested.....
I was there on a business trip and I took a walk in this park at the night. Very relaxing! A good spot for the city!
We live near Kungparken so either ride our bikes or run through it daily. It's a lovely park and in the middle of the city.
It's a great park close to the city center. We can walk long in that park There is a mill that u can see during your walking So it's a nice place for relaxing or walking
Nice place to wander or ride a bicycle through. Quiet and cool with a pretty setting for a picnic or similar
An oasis in the middle of Malmö. Children of all ages seem to be there enjoying the park with their teachers. It would hel greatly to have signage in English.
Lovely place to walk around the canals.This is a nice green space in town near the Malmahus. From here you can see the Turning Torso.
Such a beautiful park! I like how architects paid attention to details and to the lighting in the evening.
A special place to walk and marvel at the beautiful trees, lawns and gardens. It is a large park with a number of lakes and ponds.
You easily spend and afternoon strolling through this park. With good weather it's a day well spent.
Its a parkt with big old tree's from 3 continents. Nice atmosphere, but not mutch to see at, I didnt even take a photo.

Malmo really does have beautiful parks...perfect for a bike ride or a leisurely slow stroll. We had beautiful weather which always helps
This is a wonderful park in the middle of the city. A canal is flowing through, and it makes it more inviting. Duck and rabbits! are all around, a rose garden, its is beautiful.
We were in Malmo in July and Kungsparken was one of the nicest thinks in this city..very good place for relax and in the middle of the park is the small caffe which I highly recommend to visit..
I really like to stroll around in this park. A lot of different areas - some water and well maintained areas. I might even try the Gondola-Tour that have recently opened in this park!

The Kungsparken is a large urban park near the water and the central train station in Malmo. There are extensive greenspaces, walking and jogging trails, a canal that runs through the park and a rose garden. A very relaxing place to wander through.
We had a lovely walk through the park on our way to the little museums, which probably are not worth bothering with, but the park was very pretty, very green and lots of birds and trees.
A very nice beautiful park where you can easily find a spot in the shade or in the sun for a picnic. The canal running through the park adds to its charm.
Lovely well maintained park, great for a stroll. But I would go out of my way to experience it. We came across the park en route between the old town and the museum/castle.
This is an extensive park with beautiful gardens directly behind the castle. We enjoyed walking there as did many locals using it for exercise. Also a little cafe in the garden.

We walked around Kungsparken on a cool, but nice day in late June. There were sunbathers (even though I think it was about 68 degrees), picnics, and lots of flowers and gardens. It was a nice place to walk--and a lot of people rented bikes to enjoy the garden and the whole
A very beautiful park in the centre of the town. A lot of greenery :) Nice and well done paths, canals, ducks, places for relax.
The gardens are beautifully done and varied. Nice paths and great displays. Great for photos. Lots of tourists.

Enjoy the nature with all the trees, flowers and wildlife in the heart of Malmö. Sit by the canal and relax. You can get some food or just enjoy a stroll in the fresh air. Take time from the city to enjoy the country in the city.
A lovely park in the centre of Malmo to stroll through or sit and relax, with canals and various kinds of trees, ducks, etc. Comes with its own fort and windmill too.

Anywhere in the city, you are not far from a park or a wonderful water feature. This just happens to be an excellent park--well maintained and very beautiful. It is a great "shortcut" to other places in the city and it is a pleasure to walk through it. The water gardens are
The garden itself is beautiful. Didn't like the guy telling us that "in western countries you do not stand on a garden bed" even when we were outside the fence of the garden bed.

This is a lovely park lovely walks next to river loads of different trees and birds any one who goes must visit cafe over the bridge good food and a great place to sit and relax and take a walk through the lovely gardens next to it
The city is well known for it's parks and you can basically walk in parks all day. Very Close to the old castle and the beach but also on walking distance to city centre.

This is a beautiful park close to the edge of the old town. On the Sunday that we visited the weather was warm and sunny and the park was full of locals chilling and enjoying the fresh air. There was a display of 120 varieties of tulips which was simply stunning.

This park is really a very good park especially when the weather is good to stroll. The park is actually connected to different parks (it is all actually in my view just one big park divided into small sections/parks). During spring/summer season, there are some lovely plots

This is a beautiful park in central Malmo. It connects to Slottsparken and Slottstradgarden and has many beautiful little paths to explore. There are canals running through the park, a nice café, an old windmill and the parks connect to the Malmohus castle. It's beautiful,
Nice green space in the heart of the city. A good place to get away from the cityscape, and good for watching the locals.
Lovely park in the centre of Malmo that makes the trip worthwhile in my opinion. Lovely river side walks with a huge amount of wildlife. You can spend a few hours just walking around and exploring.

I understand it was February when I visited but I still had slightly higher hopes for this park. It wasn't bad but it also lacked any defining features. I decided to walk through it on the way to the park along Oresund. I felt my time may have been better spent elsewhere.

We walk through Kungsparken often; especially now that we have a baby. It is a beautiful park on the edge of the central city area within Malmo. There is a canal running through the park, plus ponds with ducks and various birds. This park also has a lovely little coffee shop

I didn't find all that much to do in Malmo but did a enjoy a stroll through the park and seeing its windmill.

One of the best natural parks in Malmö, plenty of quiet places to sit. You can bring a picnic or have coffie at any of the cafes in the park. Lots of wild ducks and birds, follow the path thru the woodland areas and discover a new surprise at every turn. In the summer a very
Beautiful park, a connection between the office building and the residential area of Malmo. It has so many geese but then Malmo is full of geese .

I've been to some great parks in Europe and the US, but this one is by far one of my favorites. Even on a cold, windy day, this park is so relaxing. It's nice to get out of the hustle and bustle of Copenhagen for a bit and enjoy the tranquility of Malmo.
This is a beautiful park and it was October when I was here so it must be absolutely superb in the summer. Lovely peaceful walks, loads of wildlife, beautiful trees, sculptures etc.

If you are looking for a serene, relaxing and quiet stroll in a park, this is the place to be in Malmo. It is a grave site and it is well maintained. There is a little grotto and a modern sculpture. It's also accessible to the casino. If you have time, stroll north west and
Wonderful place worthwhile to spend 2-3 hours - beautiful flowers all around - relaxing atmosphere and absolutely quiet

We walked through the gardens on our way to the museum. What a beautiful place, the gardens were stunning and so nice to walk through. The windmill looked lovely too. If you fancy a relaxing walk this is the place for you, or even a jog! We took the relaxing walk option.

Just a stroll through Kungsparken and Slottsparken will clear some lingering troubles. I really appreciate the man made ponds for bird life and the garden section which has the old windmill at the end. A real treasure for Malmö.

By my opinion this is niest place in Malmo. I was on vacation and after the first time I saw this park I went there every day. It is beautiful and relaxing. Perfect place to read a book, feed ducks and walk.
This is another good place where you can relax and enjoy the nature. Even when it does not have a lake, you can enjoy the trees and grass and the other things that happens at this place.
İt is aquite and relaxing place. İ was there in cloudy day but i guess more crowded in sunny days. Perfect for a good walk.
A wonderful park to stroll around with lovely green spaces, canals a castle, windmill and attractive gardens. A great place in which to relax and while away a few hours.

Every visitor to Malmo should go to Kungsparken. Ancient trees, green grass, benches and quiet. Good for a rest or an al fresco lunch.
A picnic or a day just to relax or go the the parks restaurant and have a nice cup of tea and a cake

Spent lovely afternoon in Kunsgparken, just lazing in the sun next to the river. Very relaxed atmosphere and beautifully laid out. Looks like oasis in middle of big city. Would recommend it as chill out place after doing usual tourist things in Malmo.

Relaxing, large, green and just perfect for walking alone when you need a break, or also with your family and kids (as there is also very nice playground). One of my first thing to see in Malmo :)

Walk through this calm and peaceful park was very relaxing. It was worth the visit. Due to shortage of time, we spent only 30-45 minutes walking around the park which definitely requires more time on hand.
Its nice spending time here, cool air, playground for children.. and a windmill.... we ate our lunch here, so refreshing... imagining ride a bycycle here..

Enjoyed a quiet picnic with beautiful views (lots of well maintained grassy areas as well as plenty of nice benches) and peaceful surroundings. I would highly recommend a visit!

It took us a 30 minute walk from the Malmo center to this beautiful park, but worth it , just like other prominent parks in the world compared to Central Park of New York , this also nice and very relaxing to walk and stroll, our target places are the castle and the windmill

We happened upon this garden and it ended up being one of my favorite things in Malmo. I loved the individual organic garden rooms, although wished that more had placards. The rest of the park was lovely and relaxing. Few people seemed about.

I love the city of Malmo for its beautiful parks and this one tops the list.Excellent place for a morning jog,a midday stroll and just to sit in peace and calm your mind.Just Beautiful!
A lovely place to walk through when visiting Malmo. Not at all crowded but beautiful vistas around ever corner. And right in the heart of the city.

Interesting - we preferred Malmo to Copenhagen and did not find it "tired " at all. Lovely spacious city not rammed with tourists (apart from us of course). The parks are great to walk, run or cycle through - we did all three.

We found this park to be a welcomed oasis from what can otherwise be a bit of a dreary city that has seen some better times, especially compared to Copenhagen. In particular, we enjoyed the Slottsträdgårdens Café, not too far from the Windmill, where we had some nice desserts.
Nice park to walk around on a sunny day, following the river. There's a random windmill in there too...

Wandered into Kungsparken on our last morning in Malmo, and wished we'd had more time to explore properly. The gardens were lovely, with unusual planting combinations that worked really well. The windmill is privately owned, and apparently is open to the public at some times -

I have been to parks all over Europe and agree that this is clearly one of the best in Europe. Kungsparken is the main park, just off of the city center in Malmo. It contains a large garden with rows of flowers, greenhouses, a cafe and a large picturesque windmill which is
A must visit in summer in malmo. Atmosphere and food are lovely and the gardens are just gorgeous. All the food is home made and the desserts are amazing.

I had a great day roaming through Kungsparken... even in the chilly Autumn air! I love to walk and be outside so this was a highlight for me while in Malmo because it was really nice and peaceful and fun people watching (including locals).

Great place for a walk or a run, or if you just want to relax on the grass. There are benches here and there, several located near the moat witha a view towards Malmöhus Castle (you can see the top of the castle on the other side of the moat). If you get thirsty, hungry or

Real oasis of Malmo. Lovely in the evening for a pleasant stroll. Lovely canal to walk along. This park is a lovely part of Malmo. Would like to come back as we didn't have enough time to really enjoy it.

Kungsparken is a large oasis of trees, flowers and lawns interlaced with a winding canal and located just on the edge of the Malmo city center. On a beautiful summer day it is a great place to wander and soak up the fresh air while enjoying the refreshing greenery. The park also
Very green and spacious without being overloaded with people. Beautiful flowers and a popular cafe option, also a number of secluded spot to sit and rest weary legs.

We recently spent a day in Malmo and tried to see as much as possible. The Kungsparken was a bit of a surprise but a pleasant one, with beautiful landscaping and wild birds. The windmill in the park is charming and a perfect photo opportunity, so all in all, worth a quick visit

Wanting something a bit different to cafe culture we headed towards the park. Given the weather it was very quiet but such a nice and peaceful walk. Ducks, streams and fountains with an abundant of trees with some flowers but it should be gorgeous once all the flowers have
Nice walking paths-- ducks, streams, ponds. I imagine it will be even nicer when the flowers have come out.

A great park for a walk. Close to town and the library is often a combined excursion. The variation of trees and the water with the castle in near distance gives the park a special character especially in spring and autumn

Kungsparken is one of Malmö finest parks. I great place to take a picnic. Buy some bread and cheese and a nice bottle of wine and take a walk though the park. If you have a blanket great if not there are many benches to seat on. I loved to warm evenings we have spent seating in

This really is a beautiful place to walk around at any time of the year. There are some lovely pieces of artwork, water, wonderful flowers and trees and even a windmill! I could spend all day in this park and it's very well looked after and close to the city centre too.
A good park to relax in central Malmo. We had gone for three days to Malmo and had finished with the major attractions on the first two days. It was relaxing, green and wonderful place for a picnic.

text.wiki:
Pildammsparken (Willowpond Park) is a neighbourhood and park in Malmö, Sweden, founded for the Baltic Exhibition of 1914. It covers an area of 45 hectares. 


== References ==
text.quote: Large green space with ponds, jogging paths, picnic areas & occasional seasonal concerts.

The park is really big, with a lot of different areas. It is great for a jog, and picnics in summertime!
The park is especially calm, great for a casual walk from the southern part of the city up to the centre. I liked the hedges and gardens inside.

text.wiki:
Turning Torso is a neo-futurist residential skyscraper in Sweden and the tallest building in Scandinavia.Located in Malmö on the Swedish side of the Öresund strait, it was built and is owned by Swedish cooperative association HSB. It is regarded as the first twisted skyscraper in the world.The project was designed by Spanish architect, structural engineer, sculptor and painter Santiago Calatrava and officially opened on 27 August 2005. The tower reaches a height of 190 metres (623 ft) with 54 stories and 147 apartments.In August 2015, it was announced that the building was the winner of the 10 Year Award from the Council on Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat. It won the 2005 Gold Emporis Skyscraper Award.


== Design ==
Turning Torso is based on a sculpture by Calatrava, called Twisting Torso, which is a white marble piece based on the form of a twisting human being.  It is the first "twisting" tower.In 1999, HSB Malmö's former managing director, Johnny Örbäck, saw the sculpture in a brochure presenting Calatrava in connection with his contribution to the architectural competition for the Öresund Bridge. It was on this occasion that  Örbäck was inspired to build HSB Turning Torso. Shortly afterwards he travelled to Zurich to meet Calatrava, and ask him to design a residential building based on the idea of a structure of twisting cubes.

This is a solid, immobile building constructed in nine segments of five-story pentagons that twist relative to each other as it rises; the topmost segment is twisted 90 degrees clockwise with respect to the ground floor. Each floor consists of an irregular pentagonal shape rotating around the vertical core, which is supported by an exterior steel framework. The two bottom segments are intended as office space. Segments three to nine house 147 apartments.


== Construction ==
Construction started in the summer of 2001. One reason for building Turning Torso was to re-establish a recognisable skyline for Malmö since the removal in 2002 of the Kockums Crane, which was located less than one kilometre (0.62 mi) from Turning Torso. The local politicians deemed it important for the inhabitants to have a new symbol for Malmö in lieu of the crane that had been used for shipbuilding and somewhat symbolised the city's blue collar roots.The construction of part of this building was featured on Discovery Channel Extreme Engineering TV programme which showed how a floor of the building was constructed.
Prior to the construction of Turning Torso, the 86-metre (282 ft) Kronprinsen had been the city's tallest building.The apartments were initially supposed to be sold, but insufficient interest resulted in the apartments being let. The owner has several times unsuccessfully tried to sell the building. The construction costs were almost double the estimate.


== Events ==
On 18 August 2006, Austrian skydiver Felix Baumgartner parachuted onto the Turning Torso, and then jumped off it.Floor 49 is home to the public observation deck while floors 50–52 contain a private club, meeting events, the reception, and the venue restaurant.
Floor 53 and 54 in the Turning Torso are conference floors booked and managed by Sky High Meetings. Since 2009 the owner, HSB, has decided to let the public visit these floors but only on special scheduled days, and pre-booking is required.

The tower's height is an impressive 190 metres (623 feet) with 54 storeys. It is second tallest residential building in Europe

text.wiki:
Tareq Frank Daoudi Taylor (born 30 July 1969) is a Swedish chef and restaurateur of partly Palestinian origin. He has been a television-chef for SVT in shows like Trädgårdsonsdag along with Pernilla Månsson and Go'kväll, as well as the Christmas Calendar Tusen år till julafton. He has also participated in the summer show Sommarlov for a couple of summers also for SVT. Internationally he is known for his TV-show Tareq Taylor's Nordic Cookery where he explores the Nordic Cuisine.
He has worked as a cook for 25 years. In 2014 he opened the restaurant Kockeriet where the guests get their food from different stations at the restaurant and help with preparing their own meals. In 2013 he hosted an episode of Sommar i P1 at Sveriges Radio where he talked about his career.Taylor's family consists of his wife and daughter Ellen who in 2015 participated in Sveriges Yngsta Mästerkock, a cooking show broadcast on TV4 where she placed third.


== Bibliography ==

Taylor, Tareq; Taylor Kristina, Kroon Peter (2012). Sylta, safta och lägg in. Västerås: Ica. Libris 12751118. ISBN 978-91-534-3786-4
Taylor, Tareq; Taylor Kristina (2012). Klassiker. Västerås: Ica. Libris 12341635. ISBN 978-91-534-3785-7
Taylor, Tareq; Taylor Stina (2012). Blomstrande gott. [Sverige]: Slottsträdgårdens kafé. Libris 13987856
Taylor, Tareq; Taylor Stina (2014). Helt Enkelt. Massolit Förlag. ISBN 978-91-87785-15-3

Taylor, Tareq (2017) Tareq Taylors kyckling. Bonnier Fakta. ISBN 9789174246384

text.quote: Vibrant park area featuring grassy fields, expansive gardens, a windmill & a cafe.
trip: Slottsträdgården Malmö is a "hidden" place in a nice garden! Lots of goodies to choose from! A bit pricey to the quality but ok!
This is the place you must go if you come to MalmöIn the summer time. Flowers everywhere. Safe and great for the kids. #mikemerone On youtube says you will love this place.

text.wiki:
Jumbo Jet is a steel roller coaster located at Chelyuskintsev Park in Minsk, Belarus. It originally operated from 1972 to 1978 at Cedar Point in Sandusky, Ohio. The roller coaster is a prefabricated model that features an electric spiral lift mechanism, and it was one of the earliest known coasters to use this lift mechanism.


== Ride layout ==
The Jumbo Jet, like all electric spiral lift roller coasters, reached the top of its lift hill by way of a gently-graded spiraling helix, before beginning its first drop. Unlike many roller coasters, which use a traditional chain lift, the Jumbo Jet was propelled with small wheel motors up the incline of the helix. These sort of coasters soon became a very common type of steel roller coaster in the 1970s, and were distinguished from later steel roller coaster designs that were characterized by their thicker, tubular-steel tracks. After climbing the 56-foot-tall (17 m) spiral lift, riders plunge into a series of tight turns using a figure-eight pattern and ending with a double-helix. When it debuted, Jumbo Jet was billed as the fastest of its kind and was known for its views of Lake Erie and steeply banked turns (some at up to 70 degrees).


== History ==

Jumbo Jet was manufactured by notable roller coaster designer Anton Schwarzkopf, and was the first of the Jet Star 3 model in the Jumbo Jet line. The coaster was located in the same beachfront location where a wooden roller coaster called Cyclone once stood before. It was also the location that housed the now-defunct Disaster Transport, an indoor roller coaster, as well as the location where GateKeeper stands presently. While at Cedar Point, Jumbo Jet carried between 1.6 and 1.8 million passengers every year. Jumbo Jet was eventually replaced in 1979 by the new WildCat coaster. Although Jumbo Jet was only at Cedar Point for a short time, the roller coaster subsequently moved to a number of different amusement parks, including Palace Playland in Maine, Malmö Folkets Park in Sweden, Beoland in Russia, Dreamland in Belarus, and its present location of Chelyuskintsev Park also located in Belarus.


== References ==


== External links ==
The Lost Coaster, a blog devoted to discovering the ultimate fate of Jumbo Jet
YouTube video of a Jumbo Jet recreation using the No Limits program

text.wiki:
The Öresund or Øresund Bridge (Danish: Øresundsbroen [ˈøːɐsɔnsˌpʁoˀn̩]; Swedish: Öresundsbron [œrɛˈsɵ̂nːdsˌbruːn]; hybrid name: Øresundsbron) is a  combined railway and motorway bridge across the Öresund strait between Sweden and Denmark. The bridge runs nearly 8 kilometres (5 miles) from the Swedish coast to the artificial island Peberholm in the middle of the strait. The crossing is completed by the 4-kilometre (2.5 mi) Drogden Tunnel from Peberholm to the Danish island of Amager.
The Öresund Bridge was the longest combined road and rail bridge in Europe in 2000–2019 and connects two major metropolitan areas: Copenhagen, the Danish capital city, and the Swedish city of Malmö. It connects the road and rail networks of the Scandinavian Peninsula with those of Central and Western Europe. A data cable also makes the bridge the backbone of internet data transmission between central Europe and Sweden (and, prior to 2016 also Finland).The international European route E20 crosses via road, the Øresund Line via railway. The construction of the Great Belt Fixed Link (1988-1998), connecting Zealand to Funen and thence to the Jutland Peninsula, and the Öresund Bridge have connected Central and Western Europe to Scandinavia by road and rail.
The Öresund Bridge was designed by the Danish engineering firm COWI. The justification for the additional expenditure and complexity related to digging a tunnel for part of the way, rather than raising that section of the bridge, was to avoid interfering with air traffic from the nearby Copenhagen Airport, to provide a clear channel for ships in good weather or bad, and to prevent ice floes from blocking the strait.
The Öresund Bridge crosses the border between Denmark and Sweden. Although the Schengen Agreement and the Nordic Passport Union should mean no routine passport inspections, since January 2016, identity and visa checks have been imposed by Sweden on travellers from Denmark due to the European migrant crisis.Construction began in 1995, with the bridge opening to traffic on 1 July 2000. The Öresund Bridge received the 2002 IABSE Outstanding Structure Award.


== History ==
Ideas for a fixed link across the Öresund were advanced as early as the first decade of the 20th century. In 1910, proposals were put to the Swedish Parliament for a railway tunnel across the strait, which would have comprised two tunnelled sections linked by a surface road across the island of Saltholm. The concept of a bridge over the Öresund was first formally proposed in 1936 by a consortium of engineering firms who proposed a national motorway network for Denmark.The idea was dropped during World War II, but picked up again thereafter and studied in significant detail in various Danish-Swedish government commissions through the 1950s and 1960s. However, disagreement existed regarding the placement and exact form of the link, with some arguing for a link at the narrowest point of the sound at Helsingør–Helsingborg, further north of Copenhagen, and some arguing for a more direct link from Copenhagen to Malmö. Additionally, some regional and local interests argued that other bridge and road projects, notably the then-unbuilt Great Belt Fixed Link, should take priority. The governments of Denmark and Sweden eventually signed an agreement to build a fixed link in 1973. It would have comprised a bridge between Malmö and Saltholm, with a tunnel linking Saltholm to Copenhagen, and would have been accompanied by a second rail tunnel across the Öresund between Helsingør and Helsingborg.However, that project was cancelled in 1978 due to the economic situation, and growing environmental concerns. As the economic situation improved in the 1980s, interest continued and the governments signed a new agreement in 1991.
An OMEGA centre report identified the following as primary motivations for construction of the bridge:
to improve transport links in northern Europe, from Hamburg to Oslo;
regional development around the Öresund as an answer to the intensifying globalisation process and Sweden's decision to apply for membership of the European Community;
connecting the two largest cities of the region, which were both experiencing economic difficulties;
improving communications to Kastrup airport, the main flight transportation hub in the region.A joint venture of Hochtief, Skanska, Højgaard & Schultz and Monberg & Thorsen (the same of the previous Great Belt Fixed Link), began construction of the bridge in 1995 and completed it 14 August 1999.  Crown Prince Frederik of Denmark and Crown Princess Victoria of Sweden met midway across the bridge-tunnel on 14 August 1999 to celebrate its completion. The official dedication took place on 1 July 2000, with Queen Margrethe II, and King Carl XVI Gustaf as the host and hostess of the ceremony. Because of the death of nine people, including three Danes and three Swedes, at the Roskilde Festival the evening before, the ceremony opened with a minute of silence. The bridge-tunnel opened for public traffic later that day. On 12 June 2000, two weeks before the dedication, 79,871 runners competed in Broloppet, a half marathon from Amager, Denmark, to Skåne, Sweden.Despite two schedule setbacks – the discovery of 16 unexploded World War II bombs on the seafloor and an inadvertently skewed tunnel segment – the bridge-tunnel was finished three months ahead of schedule.
Although traffic between Denmark and Sweden increased by 61 percent in the first year after the bridge opened, traffic levels were not as high as expected, perhaps due to high tolls. However, since 2005, traffic levels have increased rapidly.  This may be due to Danes buying homes in Sweden to take advantage of lower housing prices in Malmö and commuting to work in Denmark. In 2012, to cross by car cost DKK 310, SEK 375 or €43, with discounts of up to 75% available to regular users. In 2007, almost 25 million people travelled over the Øresund Bridge: 15.2 million by car and bus and 9.6 million by train. By 2009, the figure had risen to 35.6 million by car, coach or train.


== Link features ==


=== Bridge ===

At 7,845 m (25,738 ft), the bridge covers half the distance between Sweden and the Danish island of Amager, the border between the two countries being 5.3 km (3.3 mi) from the Swedish end.  The structure has a mass of 82,000 tonnes and supports two railway tracks beneath four road lanes in a horizontal girder extending along the entire length of the bridge.  On both approaches to the three cable-stayed bridge sections, the girder is supported every 140 m (459 ft) by concrete piers.  The two pairs of free-standing cable-supporting towers are 204 m (669 ft) high allowing shipping 57 m (187 ft) of head room under the main span, but most ships' captains prefer to pass through the unobstructed Drogden Strait above the Drogden Tunnel. The cable-stayed main span is 491 m (1,611 ft) long. A girder and cable-stayed design was chosen to provide the specific rigidity necessary to carry heavy rail traffic, and also to resist large accumulations of ice.
The bridge experiences occasional brief closures during very severe weather, such as the St. Jude storm of October 2013.Due to high longitudinal and transverse loads acting over the bridge and to accommodate movements between the superstructure and substructure, it has bearings weighing up to 20 t each, capable of bearing vertical loads up to 96,000 kN in a longitudinal direction and up to 40,000 kN in transverse direction. The design, manufacturing and installation of the bearings were carried out by the Swiss civil engineering firm Mageba.Vibration issues, caused by several cables in the bridge moving under certain wind and temperature conditions, were combatted with the installation of compression spring dampers installed in pairs at the centre of the cables. Two of these dampers were equipped with laser gauges for ongoing monitoring. Testing, development and installation of these spring dampers was carried out by specialists European Springs.


=== Peberholm ===

The bridge joins Drogden tunnel on the artificial island of Peberholm (Pepper Islet). The Danes chose the name to complement the natural island of Saltholm (Salt Islet) just to the north. Peberholm is a designated nature reserve built from Swedish rock and the soil dredged up during the bridge and tunnel construction, approximately 4 km (2.5 mi) long with an average width of 500 m (1,640 ft). It is 20 m (66 ft) high.


=== Drogden Tunnel ===

The connection between Peberholm and the artificial peninsula at Kastrup on Amager island, the nearest populated part of Denmark, is through the 4,050-metre (13,287 ft) long Drogden Tunnel (Drogdentunnelen). It comprises a 3,510-metre (11,516 ft) immersed tube plus 270-metre (886 ft) entry tunnels at each end. The tube tunnel is made from 20 prefabricated reinforced concrete segments – the largest in the world at 55,000 tonnes each – interconnected in a trench dug in the seabed. Two tubes in the tunnel carry railway tracks, two carry roads and a small fifth tube is provided for emergencies. The tubes are arranged side-by-side.


== Rail transport ==

The rail link is operated jointly by the Swedish Transport Administration and Danish railways. Passenger train service is commissioned by Skånetrafiken and the Danish transport agency under the Øresundståg brand, with Transdev and DSB being the current operators. A series of new dual-voltage trains was developed, linking the Copenhagen area with Malmö and southern Sweden as far as Gothenburg and Kalmar. SJ operates X2000 trains over the bridge, with connections to Gothenburg and Stockholm. Copenhagen Airport at Kastrup has its own railway station close to the western bridgehead. Trains operate every 20 minutes, once an hour during the night, in both directions. An additional couple of Øresundstrains are operated at rush hour. Freight trains also use the crossing.
The rail section is double track 1,435 mm (4 ft 8 1⁄2 in) standard gauge and capable of speeds of up to 200 kilometres per hour (120 mph), slower in Denmark, especially in the tunnel section. There were challenges related to the difference in electrification and signalling between the Danish and Swedish railway networks. The solution chosen is to switch the electrical system from Swedish 15 kV, 16.7 Hz to Danish 25 kV, 50 Hz before the eastern bridgehead at Lernacken in Sweden. The line is signalled according to the standard Swedish system across the length of the bridge. On Peberholm the line switches to Danish signalling, which continues into the tunnel.
Trains run on the left in Sweden, and on the right in Denmark. Initially the switch was made at Malmö Central Station, a terminus at that time. After the 2010 inauguration of the Malmö City Tunnel connection, a flyover was built at Burlöv, north of Malmö, where the two southbound tracks cross over the northbound pair. The railway in Malmö thus uses the Danish standard.


== Border checks ==
Both Sweden and Denmark are signatories to the Schengen Agreement, which removes border and passport controls between two participant countries. However, in January 2016, during the European migrant crisis, Sweden was granted a temporary exemption under the terms of the Schengen Agreement in order to mandate that all travellers across the bridge had photographic proof of identity. As such, travellers into Sweden from Denmark (but not the reverse) must show a valid passport or national ID card (citizens of EU/EEA countries) or passport and entry visa (if required) for nationals of other non-EU/EEA countries. The move marked a break with 60 years of passport-free travel between the Nordic countries.For the rail connection, these checks were initially enforced by legally requiring the train companies to verify the identities of travellers into Sweden, with a fine of SEK 50,000 as punishment for serving those without such identity documents. This led to the enforcement of checks by private security guards at the rail station in Kastrup airport in Denmark - an unpopular move with passengers, due to the delays imposedFrom 2017, Sweden removed this requirement and instead replaced it with more extensive direct checks by the Swedish police on entry into the country. This now takes place on board the train at Hyllie station on trains arriving from Denmark, with the checks at Kastrup fully removed.The border controls were renewed on 12 May 2019, and will remain in place until 12 November 2019, with likely further temporary renewal after.


== Costs and benefits ==

The cost for the Øresund Connection, including motorway and railway connections on land, was DKK 30.1 billion (~€4.0 billion) according to the 2000 year price index, with the cost of the bridge expected in 2003 to be recouped by 2037. In 2006, Sweden began work on the Malmö City Tunnel, a SEK 9.45 billion connection with the bridge that was completed in December 2010.
The connection will be entirely user-financed. The owner company is owned half by the Danish state and half by the Swedish state. This owner company has taken loans guaranteed by the governments to finance the connection and the user fees are its only income. After the increase in traffic, these fees are enough to pay the interest and begin repaying the loans, which is expected to take about 30 years.
Taxpayers have paid for neither the bridge nor the tunnel, but tax money has been used for the land connections. On the Danish side, the land connection has domestic benefits, mainly to connect the airport to the railway network. The Malmö City Tunnel has the benefit of connecting the southern part of the inner city to the rail network and allowing many more trains to and from Malmö.
According to The Öresund Committee, the bridge has made a national economic gain of DKK 57 billion, or SEK 78 billion SEK (~€8.41 billion) on both sides of the strait by increased commuting and lower commuting expense.  The gain is estimated to be SEK 6.5 billion per year but this could be increased to 7.7 billion by removing the three biggest obstacles to integration and mobility, the two largest being that non-EU nationals in Sweden are not allowed to work in Denmark and that many professional qualifications and merits are not mutually recognised.


== Cultural references ==
The Öresund Bridge gave its name to the Nordic noir television series The Bridge, as the series was set in the region around the bridge.
When Malmö hosted the Eurovision Song Contest in 2013, the Öresund Bridge was used as a symbol for the connection between Sweden and the rest of Europe.
It was the inspiration behind the 2014 song "Walk Me to the Bridge" by Manic Street Preachers from their album Futurology.


== Environmental effects ==
The underwater parts of the bridge have become covered in marine organisms and act as an artificial reef.

text.quote: Brick Gothic church with flying buttresses mostly dating to the 14th & 15th centuries.
trip: The building of this Gothic church is great. It is situated in the heart of the city. It has a chapel with the old fresco's which is a nice surprise to find.
A visit to S:t Petri Kryka (St. Peters Church) is a must while you’re in Malmö. The murals and decor are beautiful and a great glimpse into history.
Wonderful place and a beautiful surroundings . It’s is so peaceful and well kept. Lovely to bring the family
This Church is a must see when coming to Malmö. Its free to go in and look around. You will love it. Very old Church oldest in Malmö.
Part of the tour I took visiting Sweden , St Peters church has recently been restored , a really beautiful visit and if u are in Malmö , a must visit , bring inside u truly felt peace and tranquility
Amazingly all white inside with a wonderful 14th century chapel to the left of the door. All the frescos are original and unrestored.
This is a very old and beautiful church which is well worth visiting when walking round Malmo. Comfortable shoes are a benefit when touring Malmo because there are lots of cobbles.

A red brick church, with beautiful architecture. Very simple interior, without too many ornaments. The bell tower can’t be visited, as in other churches in Europe. All in all, not one of the most beautiful churches I’ve ever seen, you don’t need more than 15 minutes to visit it.

While staying in Copenhagen I had a free day and spent the afternoon in Mälmo. The city was quiet, it was a work day, and very clean. Transportation to and from by train was easy and walking or using a scooter while there made the trip easy. St. Petri is the oldest Church in the

Recently restored and cleaned Beautiful church with a rich history! They have recently cleaned up the very old roof paintings in the oldest part of the church! Excellent acoustics! Go to a concert here! They're free!
Impressive gilded altar and an even more impressive choir right next to the entrance with old, faded wall paintings.
We saw the spire from the square and made our way to the church a couple of minutes walk. The church is beautiful inside and worth visiting if you are nearby.
So many beautiful memories from this week. Performance by Kollektiv Knaster och Voices Of Scandinavia
Nice church to visit. Located in Malmo old town not far from Malmo Central station. One of tourist attractions when visiting Malmo.
It is one of the biggest churches in Malmo. it is beautiful and very closed to the central station. .
The Church is at the back of Malmo town hall.... The street is quiet and there many shops around... There are bench where you can sit if you are tired walking around.
Happened by while wandering near our hotel in the old town, worth the visit. It is quite lovely and full of little architectural surprises.
Might as well visit this church since it is just a short walk from Malmo Central Station or from Lilla Torg. It has interesting pieces to look at.

St. Peter's Church is right off the main square, The Stortorget, almost behind City Hall. Unfortunately the inside was closed for renovations, but we did walk around the perimeter of the church and marveled at the beautiful architecture, simple, but elegant. It is a huge
It really is a beautiful church, and one of the oldest buildings in the whole of Malmö. I’ve walked past this church a number of times now, and everyone I can’t help but admire its size and beauty.
It is a historical church, but if you live life not having seen it, you have missed nothing. If in Malmö anyway, might as well swing by to see the murals in the chapel.

As you walk towards the church it gets more impressive and bigger. Almost Cathedral like and the main church of the city. The architecture and detail are great. Inside the white walls give it a real bright and welcoming feel
Please do yourself a favour and have a look at this wonder! Plenty of seating outside for a coffee and a read.
If u r in malmo city dont miss this. This Biggest church is to be seen to Believe. Hardly 10 min walk from Central station and Little Square.
This is the city's symbol church, very big and visible from different parts of town. We could not enter.
Lovely church. We went on a Sunday and it was nice to see the candles and being surrounded with lovely artefacts. The very old part of the building is beautiful.
Couldn't visit it as it was closed at 5pm. I just saw the architecture outside and enjoyed a drink at the park around it as it is closed to the biggest mall of malmo!

This is a beautiful church and while we were there we had a concert. I think it is because it is their national day. The church itself has so much to see and enjoy and is well worth taking the time to go to. The wooden pulpit is amazing as is the new pipe organ- a real piece of

I visited St, Petri because my Great Grandmother was baptised there and was pleasantly surprised. It's a beautiful church both inside and out. With one section inside that survived reformation so you can see how intimately the church was originally painted inside. Free, right

I highly recommend visiting this church. I suggest you take a picture of the church from the back if you want to capture the whole structure...the buildings in the front are too close unless you have a wide angle lens. I thought the inside was absolutely stunning...not over

St. Petri (St. Peter's Church) is a beautiful church in the heart of Malmo! A great place to have a break from the noise in the city to visit and embrace the calmness of a beautiful church!

The church looks both majestic and modest in the same time. It's spacious (tall), it has a huge altar, but the benches and the walls are simple / modest with some decorations. It's a welcoming calm place with nice architecture.

Located behind the city hall, Saint Peter's Church is well worth popping into for a visit. The exterior is interesting, but rather dull in colour and the contrasting white interior hits you when you enter. The modern church organ is interesting. It also has an interesting
Nice church to walk to. Lovely to look at from the outside. Recommend seeing but won't blow you away

The church from the exterior to the interior is quite nice. Inside there’s a big open, light space with not a whole lot else going on. There’s a really interesting organ built into the wall. Quite peaceful inside if you fancy a break from the city.
Loved all of the history in this church - it was old and beautiful. Definitely worth stopping in and taking a look around.
most if the interior were in white paint already but there is an area where the painting were restored and the tombs are preserved. still a masterpiece. it the oldest building in malmo
