Amazing 17th century structure which was an astronomical observatory. Few highlights: 1) a spiral, sloped staircase which I saw a person pushing her loved one on a wheelchair (but do take note the last part of the climb requires to navigate a narrow stairwell with steps) 2)

This was included on the Copenhagen Card so we made the walk up. Worth doing in my opinion (only took about 20 min to see and do everything). Don't expect to be blown away with anything, just a spiral walk up to a nice view.
Really interesting historic building with good museum and information. Good value - only 60K for a family

It is a former astronomy site and very fascinating in terms of the history. It is very well kept and beautiful in terms of its construction and shapes. This is worth the small amount for an entrance fee. Lots of children running up and down. It certainly appears as though
Cheap to visit and it slopes to nearly the very top. Us humans like to climb and this hits the spot. Slopes all the way round and up. Stairs at the top. Good views at top.

This was one of the highlights of our trip to Copenhagen. It was amazing to walk up the cobbled ramp to the top. There’s lots of window seats to sit in and rest / take photos. Plus a gift shop and exhibition area with plenty of toilets. The view from the top was lovely and we

This interesting old tower has been very well revovated to accomodate todays visitors in a user friendly manner. Viewing stations and washrooms have been stategicly located. A great observation deck is located uptop.

Impressive building from outside. The walk to the top is not a strenuous one and views at the top are nice though not spectacular. The library half way up had a special exhibition on space travel which was interesting.

We could have gone up twice during our trip. It’s inexpensive, central, has amazing views, and fun to walk. There are only stairs on the last part so the walk is easy up the ramp. It’s very cool. All ages loved it.

The ticket was rather cheap, less than 50 DKK if I recall it well. You get to have a beautiful view over the city from 41m and a really lovely exhibion about the moon and land on the moon missions. The tower is considered the oldest observatory in Europe, but if you want to

This is, by far, the most important place to visit in Copenhagen. You'll easily locate it in Google maps. The top of the tower provides an overview of the city. On the way to the top there are 2 museums.

located on a part of the walking street system this tower is a great way to see copenhagen from above. the interesting thing about it is that there is a "road" leading all the way up since a former king liked to visit thew place, but appearantly did not like stairs, so he went
The views of Copenhagen from the Round Tower are very good ~ it's worth the trip up if time permits.

The Tower is very central to town, the slope to the top is not too demanding. The Moon exhibition that was on when we visited was interesting. Good value for money. We were there for about 45 minutes.
Amazing place! V surprising, incredible architecturally, amazing gallery too. Great visit, good value, highly unusual. Well worth a look.
Only DKK25 to enter, sloped ramp up most of the way then steps for the last little bit, opening up to a viewing platform with splendid views over the city!
I had read about the Tower in a guide book and had to go up to the top. There are things to look at on the way to the top too. The view at the top is great.
Going to the top to see a 360 degree view of Copenhagen is a must. Excellent chance to see the city as long as the weather is clear. It’s not too expensive and worth the climb.

This building is so gorgeous – the sloped floors leading up to the top also give you an aerobic work out! The view from the top is a 360° panoramic feast, complete with visual guides as to what you are looking at. Be sure to go to the very top and look at the inside of the

This is free with the Copenhagen Card. The gentle spiraling cobblestone path is very wide. Apparently because a king wanted to ride his horse up to the top. So lucky for us, it is free of stairs for the most part and roomy. The final stretch of the climb is up narrow stairs,

A very enjoyable experience with amazing views from the top. Also some fascinating things on the way up like the deep hole covered by glass and approached through a low narrow tunnel. Alarming if you don't know what to expect! But safe with a thick glass cover. This marks the
No lifts but a round walk up to the top. Less part of the climb is up short steep flight of stairs. Offers a 360 view of copenhagen city.

One of the stops along Kobmagergade should be the Rundetaarn. The tower is part of what is referred to as the Trinitatis Complex, the Copenhagen University Library and the Trinitatis Kirke being the other parts of the trinity. The Rundetaarn was built in the early 17th century,

Round and round you go, up the round tower. Not a difficult climb, but not exciting either. Halfway up there are a couple of exhibit halls. We liked the exhibit on the space race. Once at the top (the final bit of climb is a narrow spiral staircase) there's a good view of the

The tower is a good spot to see the city from above. Entry fee is very cheap and you can walk up in the tower nearly without any stairs (small spiral stairs at the very end of the tower to reach the platform) Good and freshly renovated toilets on two floors. Some additional
You’ll only need about half an hour here and the views from the top are worth it!! Gentle slope up to the top, but be warned there is a last tight spiral staircase that will test you!!!

There is a wide cobbled spiralling path up this tower, with interesting side rooms to nip into. (Plenty of toilets, too --- a clear bonus for many of us.) We loved seeing kids enjoying the freedom to charge up and down and felt for the parents pushing prams up to the top! Don't

This was an unusual way of getting a great view of the city. Very cheap to get in and once you reach the top. It gives you a fantastic view. We went on a clear day and could see a lot of the main buildings and even sweden. Nice thing to visit if you have the time and our nearby
It has the Tetragrammaton on the building it is very inspiring to know there was a King who loved God’s name it was nice to see the name of the true God. Beautiful history and architecture

An easy walk up the tower - we were dreading more stairs, however it is a nice sloped internal walkway with just stairs at the top so not too hard on tired feet! Nice views from the top give you an appreciation and orientation for the layout of the city and how it has been
Lovely design, especially the floor. Loved walking up the slope and enjoyed trying to spot different places using the plaques around the edge when we got to the top.
It's an interesting round building, easily accessible to the roof where you can see the city from above. Observatory is open from 18.00 and it's defo worth a visit.
Amazing experience, can't believe that they used to drive horse and carriages up the cobbled spiral tower.
The price of the ticket is low, less than a bus ticket . The view is amazing, you can see all Copenhagen, and have an idea of it. Brace yourself to walk.
It seemed like you were just going around in circles for a bit, but it's really a beautiful way to get up to the top. You have nice views when you finally get up there!

Get your legs ready...quite a climb around the tower to get to the top! The stairs to the top were a bit narrow but well worth it! We heard this tower has some of the best views in the city and it didn’t disappoint. Copenhagen doesn’t really have a lot of tall buildings.

The slope for going up is quite gentle and it does not require too much hard work to get up. Along the way, there is an art show and you can easily sit next to a window to rest and enjoy the view. Highly recommended.
A unique experience - and a great view from the top. An easy walk. Wasn’t at all busy when we visited
This place is interesting as you make your way up to the top of the tower by walking in circles. and when you reach the top, it gives a nice picturesque view of the city.

Having been to Copenhagen a number of times, we were looking for something different to do on this visit, and a trip up the Round Tower did the job. It is cheap, an easy walk up (except for the final few stairs) and some great views from the top. There are some other

A quirky Seventeenth Century round tower with a hollow core and the equestrian staircase, it is well worth climbing to the top for the panoramic views over Copenhagen. A few more steps take you into the observatory at the top of the tower.

Even though it is a very long way up, and the spiral just seems to keep going, it is a relatively easy incline. There is also a good number of windows to stop and take a break at if the need takes you. Wonderful view at the top and a toilet half way up! What more could you want?

It only costs 25K, so very reasonable. the walk up is quite long so you need to be reasonably fit. There are stops on the way up and down with an interesting view of the original oak beams which was lovely

Walking up the Round Tower isn't too difficult. The incline is gradual and wide. Except for the last bit where there are a few (maybe 20) narrow stairs with one way traffic. The views up top are great with 360 panoramas in all directions of Copenhagen. The only complaint is the
Great views in this Tolkien-like round tower. Beware of the final stairs. Not for people with claustrofobia.

The tower is in the city centre and it is possible to see a nice view of Copenhagen. The tower cost 25 DKK and it is easily accessible since there is a wide spiral without stairs until almost the rooftop. Only in the last part there are narrow stairs. When you are at the top,

During a recent 4 day visit to Copenhagen with friends, my husband and I purchased the Copenhagen Card for the unlimited public transportation. We knew there were also a couple of sites we wanted to see that were included... but thanks to this Card, we got a chance to go into
Modern cities could not build this today. Copenhagen have beautiful restored this historical treasure and opened up a very inexpensive way to look out over the city. Recommended

Nice walk up to the top of this tower. The way up is formed as a path only at the very end there are a few stairs. The entrance fee is not expensive. Panoramic view on top. Was an unexpectedly nice surprise.
This tower is attached to a church. The tower was built so that the king could ride in his carriage to the top. It does offer some views.

I really enjoyed this site. The walk to the top was fun and views from top terrific. On the way to top they have arranged fun facts/stops along the way and intros of other ramp towers in Europe. Make time to see the church attached to the tower too.

Interesting building with a unusual spiral ramp taking you up to a viewing platform and observatory. Sadly the observatory was closed but the view over the city was amazing. Well worth the trip up. At several points on the way up you an see into the church, the inner bell tower

The interior is one big spiral ramp. At the very top are some stairs up to the telescope in the observatory. And the views from atop will reward your climb. Since it is do centrally located (Copenhagen center) it’s worth the short visit. As an aside, it’s along a quieter
Worth a visit to get a good panorama of the city. Good signs at top to help orientate yourself. Definitely worth the effort
It's not as hard as you may think, and its definitely worth it. Fantastic views at the top... Great to get an idea of your whereabouts in the city. You can see the Malmo bridge in the distance!

Even though,reputedly,Norwegians have claimed tha<t they have towers much higher,and much rounder,back in Norway,this is still of interest.Supposedly,with the encircling sloping walk,you once could ride up to the vto on horseback.

It is always one of those places that you almost have to tick off. It is very much worthwhile. It's not often you see a tower like this from the inside.. with the beautiful brickwork and slope that goes up to the top. It's rather enchanting. It does get rather busy with tourists

Walked up the inside of this tower which is a ramp, rather than steps. Fabulous views all over Copenhagen from the viewing deck at the top. It’s not too hard a walk up, and there are good clean toilets in there. Well worth a visit. Go into the attached church at ground level too

Not only mounting this tour is a great experience, in the lower part no stairs and easy upward mounting, then at the top very narrow staircase opening up stunning views on the city. As Copenhagen is rather flat, you see a lot of the city.
A really surreal place, your mind can’t quick scope the way it’s is made, would consider it a must visit. Also visit the church attached to it, it is beautiful

This place is slap in the middle of the town centre, and you can find it easily, as it's the tallest building for miles. Interestingly, there are no stairs - it's one long spiral slope, all the way to the top. What's strange about this, is that it actually makes it easier to

I went here using my Copenhagen card and was in and out within 30 mins. They have an art exhibition in there if you are into modern art. At the top is the observatory which you cannot enter (you view it from behind the bars).
Quick and easy no fuss it's a slope from the bottom to the top apart from last steps which consists of only 20 to 30 steps to the open air outside. It's a wonderful view on Copenhagen centre.

We new nothing of this very unusual tower until we saw it on the guide. There is a small charge but worth it. The gradual slopping floor surface is the only one of this type in the world! The construction is very unusual and free brochures to hand. Great alround views from the

It is a great experience to walk up in this old tower. The view from the top is just great, The tower is situated in the old part of Copenhagen and it is a very interesting area and your can really feel the history!

This is not stunning, and yet was one of our favorite adventures. It was fun to walk up the inclined interior brick road to the top. Again, the view is not breathtaking, but the history of the tower made up for it. Worth the small entry fee.

Only 20 minutes to walk up a gradual large brick ramp. There is plenty of head space. Apparently, Peter The Great rode to the top on his horse! The viewing platform is spacious and has wonderful views of the city. There is even a fully functional toilet and sink part way up the
Excellent value for money, quite a steep walk up to the very top but worth it if you are able to make it - lovely views over a beautiful city!

You only need 20-30 mins for this, and it's pretty easy to climb as it's gentle slopes most of the way up. It's interesting to go to see, especially with its link to Brahe. The views at the top are worth it as well to get a good overview of the city.

A tower with a difference. Theres some interesting history behind the towers development and reason behind its commission. It adds to what would otherwise be a labouring climb, worth it for the blustery views from the top!
We enjoyed the walk up the spiral ramp to the top of this tower. The views of the city were beautiful. Highly recommended!!

We hesitated walking up the tower but then decided to go for it. The ramp is a much better way to make your way up to the top and there were a few places to stop on the way up which made it even easier. The last bit up the narrow staircase is a bit of a pain as people are going
Super cool tower in the centre, above a church. Amazing views, fun stuff inside and pretty cheap! Well worth a visit!
Denmark is expensive so when you can get up the top of the tower for the same price as a Danish pastry it's a bargain! Definitely worth saving for a sunny day to get a great view of the city.

This Round Tower was built by one of the Danish Kings so that he could ride his carriage up to the top and look out over Copenhagen. Worth the small admission price and the walk up. Great views of Copenhagen

This is a must see and very close to the major shopping area in Copenhagen. For a small admission you can walk to the top of the tower on a circular carriage path until to reach the stairs. It is so unusual that it shout be seen. If you have walking difficulties at least see
There are lots of stairs leading up to the observation area at the top. It is a little tiring but well worth the admission price for that view.
Nothing special but when you reachthe top there is a stunning view.it might be difficult if there's too much people. But well worth visiting while in Copenhagen

It's worth visiting the tower despite the expensive ticket and the uphill climb (no elevator or stairs, you just walk round and round inside the building). It's a nice experience though. The view on top is amazing.

We used our Copenhagen cards to get into the Round Tower for free. It’s certainly an interesting concept- having a tower that you can ride a horse up! The last tiny bit was steps, but literally only a few. I’m relatively unfit and managed this- there are places to rest along the

Unlike most towers, the Round Tower is a wide circular ramp leading to the viewing platform where one may get a complete view of the city. The entry is not expensive and is covered by one of those museum cards. One can go as fast or as slow as one wants to reach the top as

It is a funny experience to walk in circles to come up to the tower. Rundetarn (Round Tower) doesnt have stairs. It has a nice view of Copenhagen from the top, There was also an art gallery. It definitely worth to visit.

We visited the round tower as we thought it was a must do in Copenhagen and we were not disappointed. The walk up the ramp is easy until you get to a steep and narrow spiral staircase where people are coming up and down at the same time so it can get quite busy and you have to

Good fun attraction for families. We arrived at opening time so had a clear run up to the top. Our two boys enjoyed following this unique spiral around, exploring the nooks and crannies, and of course the view from the top. Good for energetic little ones, and pretty manageable

The tower is pretty nice in itself, but the best part is probably the view over the central Copenhagen. Inside the tower there are two floors of exhibisions, during our visit one was arcitecturral designs in circles.

I only cost about 3 dollars American to enter this cool structure, or it is included with the Copenhagen card. The spiraling ramp takes you to the top for some great views of the city. There are a couple small museums on the way up as well. Its not far from Rosenborg Castle.

After seeing this on a tv programme about Copenhagen, we added this to our must-visit list and we were not disappointed. We had Copenhagen cards so I'm not sure what the cost would normally be but I would recommend a visit regardless. The walk up the spiral ramp is easy and

Sometimes when you visit a city you just need to say I did that. Felt this was one because of its historical significance and uniqueness. You can take your time as you go round and round the tower, and then at the top you are rewarded with a great view.

After viewing photos of this I decided to see for myself and perhaps do some photography. It is an amazing structure and the photography is awesome, highly recommend even if not a photographer. We had a Copenhagen card so not sure how much it costs but worth it. There is a

This is a unique experience going around and upwards on this spiral ramp seven and half times—over 120 feet. The cylindrical tower has a walkway wide enough to fit a large horse carriage as intended. The walkway comes to an end where you have to climb up some very narrow

Built by Christian IV, almost bankrupted Copenhagen, but Happy he went ahead. It was built as an Observatory in the 17th century. You should be in good shape, and have good knees, its a long way up, but worth the pain! Its on Købmagergade , (Merchants street) ca 5-10 minute walk
The easy walk up to the top of the tower is well worth the effort. Only at the top there are some narrow steps. On the top you can see most of the city with descriptions of what you see. Very good!
Lovely place with a nice view. No steps 🙂 good idea. The tower is really nice. On the top is a small shop for the turist where you can buy souveniers or something for drink.

Nice easy smooth climb, interesting displays on the floors on the way up. Free with Copenhagen Card. On sunday until 4pm access to the observatory. The tower was part of the old University and the obsevatory was used for that purpose. The kind gentlemen will answer questions if

This is unlike anything I've seen elsewhere, a spiral ramp winding to the top and a gorgeous 360 degree view. All kids love running up and down ramps, and there are little cubby holes to hide in along the way. It's not too strenuous to get to the top and the view is beautiful
This is a pleasant enough tower to climb, and quite family friendly with not too many steps yet offering decent views. Worth a visit.

Take a run up the round tower and enjoy the view from the top. Another of Christian the Fourth’s buildings, this one was allegedly to impress the Russian tsar, as Chr. 4 could ride up to the top on his horse (though he would have benefited from the exercise by walking 😬)
Glad I was able to visit this tower. King Christian the 4th was a man ahead of his time and he knew who was behind all his great works.

The unusual feature of the tower is it's broad helical walkway to the top (almost, as there are a few steps to complete the ascent). On the way up is a view into the church, an exhibition room (on my visit housing an impressive artwork), cafe and toilets. Exiting onto the
Kids had fun walking to the top of the round tower in Copenhagen. Great view from the top, and some interesting information and displays within the tower.
Just unusual structure inside. Easy to walk, even carriages could earlier make it. On the other hand nothing special.

Loved it, except for the spiral staircase at the end that's a bit too tight for two opposing streams of people Great view from the top and easy on the knees whist climbing the ramp up, because of the low nature of Copenhagen the view from the top is special, would recommend

This 17th century round tower is the oldest functioning observatory in Europe. We payed $25 Kroner (apparently free with a Copenhagen Card). The spiral walkway leads you up to the view (36 meters up). Not the best city for panoramics but at least you're not taking pics through

Quite a climb, but worth it. Offers a viewing platform at the top with a sweeping view. The first part of the climb up is a unusually wide and easy ramp - it was built to accommodate horses to carry heavy loads up. Where visited on a Sunday in July, and got a change to take a

It's a good climb up the tower, but well worth the view of Copenhagen! Walking up the tower it's an incline, and then there are very narrow stairs towards the top. There is an elevator for those with disabilities. There's a snack bar and small gift shop at the top , as well.

Took a half hour excursion up the tower when my family members were busy shopping nearby. Kind on my knees (few stairs) and quite a bit of fun to go round and round and all the way up to the top where one could get a pretty decent view of the city. One of the cheaper

Walking up Rundetaarn is a great way to spend half an hour if you’ve got the time. It gives you great views of the city in all directions - on clear days the views are immense and you feel like you can see all of Copenhagen!! (But be warned there is a very tall fancy that kind

If you wanna take whole entire city view the round tower is the best way. Might be a bit of walk to the observatory space from the ground but one your way you can also enjoy taking some photos at photo spot.
Pretty cool to walk up there, entrance was like 5 euros per person. Then you climb the tower which is not that steap, which gives a nice view over the city

This is well worth the walk up to see the amazing views arounf the city! Its flat surface you walk right until last part and there are some very narrow steps to climb - they say its 2 way but I would advise 1 way as they are very narrow at 1 side!

The walk up Rundetårn is quite easy, as it is a spiral ramp that is quite wide. Up on the viewing deck, you have nice views over the city. The telescope upstairs is in action on Sundays, when experts explain it. At the time of our visit, it was, however, only aimed at Our
Inexpensive 30 minutes. Walk up to the top. No stairs but a cobblestone road all the way to the top. Great views of the city. The kids love it. A true cardiac event. Enjoy

Rundetarn was built as an observatory and the story of the internal 'road' that climbs story by story varies, but both versions are viable. It was either to haul equipment to the top by horse, or, the person to built it needed to ascend by horse as he was not able to. Most

It’s a 30 minute stop. The tower has no stairs. You walk on a ramp all the way to the top. There’s only a round staircase at the very top. A little tight if there are people going in both directions but is only a few steps (I’d guess 20-30 steps). We did it on a Sunday

At 30Dkr entrance I would say this is a must see. Walk up the tiled spiral walkway to the top of the tower. There’s a stop on the way up where you can see exhibitions or use the toilets in the ticket price. A little further up theres a doorway in to the center hub of the tower.

It's a six storey or so brick tower with an internal sloping walkway - imagine the NYC Guggenheim, only with no central void, no skylight and no art - so basically a folly. It's accessible and a bit odd, but that's about it. The view is unremarkable; there's nothing to spark
Included in our Copenhagen card but not expensive if you buy a ticket once there. Great view of the city, and such an interesting building to walk up to the top!
If you want to get the best view over Copenhagen Rundetaan is a must see on a clear day you can see far away

For little money you get a great 360° view of Copenhagen accompanied by history and art (there are exhibitions in the old library). The way up is nearly stairless (it is a foot path with 7 1/2 rotations) except for the last bit. To get to the outdoor viewing platform you have to
This might not be high on the must-see list, but especially if you have a CPH Card, spend an hour walking up the round tower and seeing CPH in a 360 view.

A round tower with a 360-degree view of the city, worth visiting towards sunset for seeing the city in light and darkness. It has an active telescope in the summer months, posters of large constellations, the moon, the sun and the rest of the planets. Do not miss the
Interesting building to walk up seven flights No stairs. Very affordable Nice view at the top ......

Worth a visit, first part is fairly easy, relatively gentle shape, then some steepish stairs, then a tight stone spiral staircase. I’m okay with kind of stuff but my wife bailed out at the foot of the steep stone stairs. Worth the climb to the top as the views re

The tower is in the very heart of Copenhagen, the ticket is quite cheap, especially if compared with the general prices in town. The view is quite nice, even if the tower is not too tall. It's worth a visit!
Great view of the city ...a little bit of a climb. Well worth the effort. Little bits of information about the tower as you go up. Lots of history.

The round tower is a good and cheep way to experience the whole city from a high level. It costs 25 Danish crowns and after a 5 minute walk you are in the top of the tower. From there you can see the whole Copenhagen and its beautiful architecture.
This historic building has been a distinctive feature of Copenhagen's skyline since 1642. It has a lookout tower and observatory. There is a charge so I did not go up

We followed the ascending slope all the way to the top, viewing the rooms en route. We then climbed the stairs ... quite narrow to the roof top and enjoyed the splendid views across Copenhagen. We could even see Sweden and the bridge.

We got here right when it opened at 10AM and had a spectacular view of the city from the top of the tower. The tower also has a small art exhibit which is worth seeing as well. This a perfect way to start your day of sightseeing in Copenhagen.
Set on a busy shopping route, this gem is has a spiral ramp which takes you to the top from where you get super views of the whole area. It costs just 25 DKK to enter (or around £3).

A steep but rewarding walk up the Rundetarn ... no steps but uneven cobbles (not ideal for elderly or disabled), it's fascinating to see how the tower is constructed (was an observatory originally) there is a viewing platform at the top which gives great views over Copenhagen

Great viewing point and interesting art exhibit too. Walk up slope, then steps, then narrow steps so difficult for anyone with poor mobility. The view from the top is great, all round Copenhagen, so well worth the trek.
In the middle of the city, hundred yards or so from famous Walking Street. Beautiful view of the city from the top.

On the face of it this place doesn't seem that interesting. A tower with no steps so some rich guy could ride his horse to the top to look at the starts but we really enjoyed it!! The walk up was easy. Anybody can go at any pace they want and there are no steps so it's better
The tower is located in Central Copenhagen and was originally built as a astronomical observatory.Did not climb to the top,but can imagine the view.
You have to go up a spiral ramp all the way up. Easy to climb with amazing views of the city. An observatory right on top.

A top ten visit in CPH. If you want to see Copenhagen from a different vantage, this is the place. A real treasure of the city, steeped in history, easy to access and not to be missed. I love to walk to the top. Yup it’s ramped rather than stepped 🔆 and just sit for a bit and

It’s worth reading about the history of this 17th Century Tower before you visit. Unlike most European towers that I have climbed, this one has a brick floored ramp almost as far as the top (wide enough for a horse and cart) But If you want to see the panoramic views of the

It's a good walk to the top but we haven't seen another tower as well kept as this after 400 years. Walk steadily and the 9+ one stories go quickly. It is not stairs but a wide, curving walkway. The 360 degree view of Copenhagen was worth the walk, but the open arches were

We were a group of five, with 3 children (ages 7-12), and found this tower to be easily accessible for everyone to walk up. It is not steps, but rather a ramp that circles around in the tower. There were restrooms along the way. The view from the top was wonderful. It was a
Definitely worth the walk up! The space is serene and welcoming. And the views from the top are amazing. So glad we added this to our Copenhagen bucket list.

This is an easy climb because of the circular path rather than steps which provide the great reward on top. It’s a bit tight on the narrow staircase leading to observatory as you take turns for traffic. Part way up was an art exhibition worth the visit and also another area

Rundetårn (Rundetaarn) is one of the most famous attraction in Copenhagen. It is situated in the centre of the town. It is 34.8 meters and is built as an astronomical observatory and connected with the Trinitatis Church. It is built in the 17th century by Christian IV of

There is something special about this church. Inside the main church is light, airy, peaceful and beautiful. Then there's the tower which a sloping climb to the top, rather than steps, for amazing views over the city and a few stops for history lessons on the way (and loos!)

It is not only impressive architecture as you keep going in circles on the rampart, not only historical landmark, but also offers a fantastic view all around the city. One of the tunnels leads above the church. Really good! No elevator but access with stroller is ok up to the

We came here as we had free entry using the Copenhagen card and it is definitely worth a visit. This strange little unique tower has a ramp style walkway to the top where you can see the whole city! great location for photos. Worth a visit

This was a pleasant and unique climb to the top as you are on more of a ramp until close to the top where you have to climb some stairs. The view from the top was nice. There were also several different places where you could stop along the way to view either an exhibition or
Very old church with an interesting history. Climb the tower to get great views of the city. Also has a small art gallery on the second floor that has neat displays.
If you have the Copenhagen Card, this is free. It's in the heart of the tourist/shopping district, take the 10 minutes to walk up the spiral and learn the history of this observatory. Neat!
Convenient ascent through level ramps. Very nice view over the whole city, the harbor, the Öresund bridge and up to Sweden

I visited this tower as it was included in the Copenhagen Card, so I got in for free. I wouldn’t recommend paying for this experience. There are better vantage points in the city dwarfing the tower that offer unobstructed views. Unfortunately there is a fence all around the roof
Beautiful views and the walk up the tower is interesting in itself. The exhibitions were also very good.

A tourist attraction for it being Rundetårn in its own right. A further attraction for its exhibition. Rundetårn has astronomic value and history dating back to King Christian 4th. Rundetårn translates directly as round tower. Indeed you walk around around and around until you
Good value attraction which only takes about half an hour. Great views from the top. Also worth a walk around the building outside.

I stopped here the day after visiting Church of Our Savior and was unsure if I needed to do another observation tower. But I'm glad I did! The history of this tower adds to the experience, and it's also a ramp all the way to the top. Even if you do the Church of Our Savior, I

The Round Tower is an absolutly easy and cheap (25 DKK) way to gain a wonderful view of the city. Except the very last bit, there are no stairs to be climbed. A king built this observatory and he made sure that a horse-drawn carriage could bring him up the tower. So the way up

It was well worth going up the round tower, there are things to see on the way up, like the Old Privy and the central cavity. There is a great view from the top and the planetarium round the corner at the top which is worth a look.

This was the first place we visited when we arrived in Copenhagen. My 4 year old had a blast going up the never-ending ramp and hiding from his mom in the many different alcoves. Wonderful views of the city from the top-- great way to start getting oriented with the city upon

'Free' with Copenhagen Card. Sloping access a first and enjoyable but there are a few stairs at the very top. Unfortunately raining so we didn't stop for long to look at views. Peeked at the observatory - although couldn't fully access as gate locked.
When you go up the Round Tower, its a spiraling walkway, you get the best views of the entire city of Copenhagen, there is also a museum and artifacts throughout.

It is what it says: a round tower. Except for the view from the top, nothing to get excited about. No major architectural masterpiece and dull color. Copenhagen has better to offer i.e. boating through the canals or taking a stroll in Nyhavn admiring the colorful houses. And
Historic building with a tower where you approach by an ascending incline,a total of 7.5 turns of the incline gets you to the top with fantastic views of the lovely city of Copenhagen.

It’s a beautiful structure, you have a beautiful view of the city. There’s an exhibition in one of the floors and pretty cool details to explore too. I really believe it’s worth the climb and the visit.

Lovely Danish architecture as you walk up the ramp, (literally) topped off with great views of Copenhagen. It's not a particularly steep ramp up the tower, nor does it take particularly long to get up to the top, but perhaps it's not recommended for those with mobility
Lovely historical walk up to see pretty 180 degree views of Copenhagen and beyond. Nice art exhibits along the way up. Bathrooms are located about half way.
A unique way to walk up the tower with a spiral road all the way up. Some great views of the city at top. The obsevatory at top and libarary area was also good. Must do .
Nice building, interesting. The view from the top is quite nice. There was a cool exposition in there. Worth the visit (and the climbing :)
We loved this place, really cute. Climb at the top is a bit tight.. 2 way traffic with tight stairs that curve, but the view is worth it

The church at the bottom is free of charge for visiting and really nice. The tower is quite small, costs about 7 euros to climb it (Copenhagen Card free) and you can't see too much from up there. But it's a nice place to visit if you don't have other things to do and specially

The idea of a tower without steps sounded fun and new. The climb was not hard. However, there is a small set of stairs at the very end, so beware. The view was also very good. We could see all of Copenhagen!
Fun to do and nice view over the city. On your way up you can have a look in the museum where they have different expositions.

Because this tower is a gently curving slope it is easy to climb with plenty of places to sit on the way up. To go out at the top you do need to go up about 20 narrow steps but the view is 360 degrees at the top. It costs 25 krone each to go in. Half way up is the exhibition/

Fantastic structure right in the centre of Copenhagen. The sloping floor all the way to the top is so much easier than stairs. The views of the city from the top are amazing and there are plaques depicting which buildings are which. We had Copenhagen cards so entry was free.
Beautiful building with fantastic views from the top. There was an exhibition on while we were there which was very good. Very reasonably priced to go in.
nice spiral walking ramp to near top,,,,,a small tight staircase near the top....well worth the trip to the top...

This is such a neat building and just being a huge ramp it is so much easier to walk up than other towers with stairs. It doesn’t take very long to get to the top. It’s bright and beautiful. The views of Copenhagen from the top are stunning even on a rainy and cloudy day. I

The whole history of the place, from Hans Christian Anderson to astronomer, Tycho Brahe, made our visit more meaningful though the library Mr. Anderson used has been converted to a lecture hall. Whispers of the old astronomical observatory used by Mr. Brahe back when is

This is a brilliant little attraction to see. It’s only 25kr (£2.95) to get into and it’s totally worth it. The building inside is very aesthetically pleasing with several little rooms on the way up to visit. Once you get to the top, the views are amazing. You can see across

Visited Rundetarn with the family while on vacation and we all enjoyed the interesting building and the great views it offers. Rundetarn is a tower in the center of Copenhagen that was designed in such a way that carts could be pulled up the inside ramp to the top. This makes
This is the center of Denmark. That made it important for me. The walk to the top was easy and fun. only takes 1 hour.

We arrived first thing in the morning to make the climb to the top of the tower, and enjoyed a relatively peaceful journey throughout our stay there. The view from the top was impressive, as was the historical importance of the tower. We especially enjoyed checking out the art
This is the best way to see the city. It’s a nice easy walk up wide ramps opposed to stairs making it a much easier climb. Once at the top... fabulous city views!
An easy walk to the top rewards you with fantastic views of Copenhagen. The Round Tower is an interesting place to visit.

This was a great place to visit to learn about some city history and current uses for the Round Tower. It’s an easy walk up a inclined ramp with only a few narrow steps at the top to reach the roof. The city views are very nice on a clear day. Remember to visit the attached
The tower has a walkway to the top. This is so strange. Only the last part has some steps, maybe 25, and the very last part is a bit narrow. The view on top is really great.
We loved to climb this tower. The view was great and we liked the fact there was no stairs or elevator. You could just walk your way up.

We enjoyed walking up the round tower ramps, appreciating that they're not too steep. There are places to stop that have the history of the tower and the area and people. At the top you go up a steep round staircase and end up with gorgeous views of Copenhagen! So glad we

This is one of the easiest walks up to some pretty great views that you’ll probably ever experience. And at just 25 DKK (less than $4) it is very reasonably priced. Most of the walk is on a interior spiral ramp. The ramp makes for an easy walk with steps only near the top and

This was great and more than expected. Price tag is reasonable. Not being g much of an architectural buff I was surprised how we both became animated discussing the shapes and what it would have been like to build it in the 1600's. We went between 6.30 and 8pm which was nice,

Pretty central with a good view, I’d highly recommend this considering it’s low price. It’s also included in the Copenhagen Card. A bit different. You can see all the way to the bridge on a clear day.
Worth the climb for the views. Copenhagen Card included entry so a must on passing. We would have paid anyway.

It is a historical landmark with a good story behind it. The exhibitions that are inside are better than structure. You will get a great view of the city from the top but you are going to have to walk up there.

I really enjoyed the walk up the tower. It has a unique design, and there were points of interest along the way. There was also an art exhibition for us to walk around (and take a break from walking up!) The view was beautiful once we got to the top, and we stayed up for a while

It´s rather easy to walk up, there are no steps but just gentle way up. Take your time and see all the fun little things on the way to the top. There are cool little info leaflets on the way, take them and read about. There is sightseeing plattform on the top giving 360 view of

We were walking around town and came upon this fun find! No stairs--which is awesome--but rather a circular walkway/incline all the way to almost the top. Then there's about 20-30 steps? It doesn't matter because the view at the top is lovely. Has bathrooms, too!

Definitely a worthwhile site to visit in Copenhagen. This is a tower climb unlike any other that I've tried - a unique circular walkway nearly all the way up rather than stairs, and relatively speaking much easier to tackle. The climb itself would be worth it for the visit, an

The best view in the city! of Copenhagen Well worth the walk up, which is fun and easy, albeit a steady incline with stairs at the end. Take notice of the historical notations along the way and peek in the bell tower. A great way to orient yourself to the layout of the city
Easy to visit, nice view all Copenhagen. Surprising to see strong relation with astronomy in these years (17th Century). Must take photos in helical corridor :-)

From the top of the Round Tower, you get a Panoramic View of the City. The tower was built by King Christian the 4th. There is a path up to the top that was built so he could ride up in his horse and carriage. It is connected to the beautiful church next door where there are

RundeTårn was in the old days a observatorium for People to study the planets and the stars and Also to Keep a eye on town. The tower is located just by the local shopping street "strøget" It cost 25 dansish kr to get up in the tower for an adult, 5 kr for children. There is no

It’s an easy walk up a broad circular ramp until the last set of stairs one more level up. There are windows all the way up with seats so you can look out in all directions as you go. At the top you get a rooftop view of the city and can orient yourself to all the landmarks.

This iconic building has few surprises. The way up is quite easy except for the last 20 - 30 very narrow steps. Half way up is the old library with seasonal exhibitions. Currently interesting tapestry. The core has been opened and you can see the foundations through see through
A nice walk for a small fee to the top. Not strenuous for young and old. There are places to sit along the way up if you get tired. There’s a fabric art display on the way up as well.
The tower itself is somewhat interesting but the best part is the view from the top. The walk up is circular & steady. The information at the top let's you know what you are seeing.
A hidden gem. Nice steady walk to the top for a great view even though it was freezing cold at the top. Good couple of exhibitions to see on the way up. Very good value for money

Located near the university, the Round Tower is not exactly round, but the walkway up certainly is and it offers some interesting views over the city from the top. Personally, I preferred the views from the tower at Christiansborg. It opens at 10:00am, but there are numerous
Centrally located and offers a good view in all directions. Map sketches put up on the viewing platform are helpful to know the names of the sights and orient oneself.

The tower has no stairs, its a ramp that leads up to the top, the last bit though are stairs... There is no students discount... but the price is okay with 25Krones. There are also washrooms in the tower to use. There are art exhibisions you can take a look at as well.
Easy walk up a winding hill instead of stairs. Great views of the city at the top for the low price of 25 DKK per person.

The Round Tower is such a beautiful building with an even more beautiful lookout with great city views from the top. Even though it's just a simple "round" building where you basically walk in circles to get to the top (this is more fun than it sounds!), once you get to the top

We really loved this-- its so interesting and unique! The spiralling ramp which takes you all the way to the top is a great experience. The views from the top are also lovely! Its very cheap and I would recommend.
Unique and Instagram-worthy Easy to walk up even with a stroller My boy enjoyed running up and down.. Great views from the top. Very reasonable entry prices!

Wow, what a joy. Wide accessible easy to walk up, and down, tower. It's fun, beautiful, historic and definitely worth visiting. We saw a temporary exhibition half way up, some walked right past which is a shame, it was great. Also don't miss the tiny glass 'hole, you can go in
Stroll through the easy path going up. Also the children liked it. You can hide in the small caves and surprise your sister.

Not expensive - 25DK pp to climb the 8 (i think!) rotations up to the viewing platform (outside, no cover). Most of the climb is flat, spiralling walkway but there are a couple of short stair climbs at the very top out on to the viewing platform. Cool on a breezy day. Fantastic
This was fun and well priced.Toilets are available.Would be difficult for anyone with mobility issues.The view was amazing.

The round tower was built in the early 17th century by King Christian IV and actually remains a functioning observatory - the observatory at the very top of the tower is not actually accessible most of the times. You walk to the top not by taking stairs, but up a 270 meter or so

This is a must see. It is an easy walk up and only gets a bit challenging at the top with the narrow and steep stairs to get to the observatory. I am not a fit person, but this was not that hard to climb, so please don't let people deter you. For most of the walk up the tower

We visited the tower around sunset and although it gets very windy (went in April) up there we enjoyed the amazing view. The climb may seem easy at first, but when you arrive at the narrow stairs it can be difficult as it is used both ways, up and down, at the same time.

It was my second visit and I am sure that it was not the last one. Very centrical, few minute walk from Nørreport metro station and very nice view - Copenhagen in 360 degrees. Last time I was lucky that the astronomy observatory was open too but today it was closed. There is a

This is by far the easiest tower to climb ever. The steady slope allows people with mobility issues access to the first viewpoint. The very top part, is a spiral and it says access up and down together, but no way my feet would fit on the narrowest part. I think that is quite

If you are not physically fit, then this is a pass. Once inside the entrance way there is a spiral incline up to a narrow set of stairs which is extremely congested due to its limited space. If you make it, there is a nice view of Copehagen, however, I am not sure if it is
Worth the walk up the spiral ramp for the views, and an interesting gallery on the way back down. Maybe they could introduce a traffic-light system on the little staircase at the top?

This lovely building provides a panoramic view of the city even for those who don’t like heights. The entrance fee is nominal and well worth the view from the top. There are no steps you simply brace yourself for the wide gradient and up you go. Along the way there are resting

Came here as it was free on our Copenhagen card and we were passing. Definitely with the climb up to see the observatory at the top. To enter you climb a steady ramp. There are various stopping points on the way up, as well as a cafe and toilets. Great views from the top!
Not the most enthralling if viewing decks, but nice in its own way. The views over Copenhagen are sort of boring compared to other cities, but nice nonetheless
It's a tower that has almost no stairs at the beginning. It's something different. The views up are also cool!

At only 25dkk to get in, this is a bargain. The tower is in the middle of the city and inside there is a long, wide spiral walkway that is very easy to walk up. At the top there is a short spiral staircase to reach the roof. Wonderful views fruition the roof of the city. I

As with most areas of interest around Copenhagen, it’s not exactly the best, tallest tower you’ll climb in a city but it’s certainly interesting. Most of the climb is done via a gradual sloping spiral, only towards the top will you encounter steps. The final few are quite
The entrance is 25kr for adults and 5kr for kids - very cheap. The view from the top is always fantastic.

My daughter and I went up to the tower and we enyoyed it. We we're also able to join the activity where we can build our own tower. The crews facilitating the "build like a king" activity we're all very nice and helpful. The only downside was the last stairs going up the actual

I always try to find the views when visiting new cities/places. This was the one for Copenhagen and you can practically see the whole downtown, since there aren't that high buildings there. I always admire the workmanship put into building these kind of places - in this case it

I guess this really is a gem in Kopenhagen and a must see! We found it only by mistake one night and sheduled it for our next day. Its pretty nice walking up and the view over the city is fantastiv from above!

The Round Tower is a very interesting building in Copenhagen. Built originally as an astronomy tower the views from the top are really beautiful. The walk up isn't too demanding as you're walking up a constant slope. There are some stairs at the top, but again, not bad at all.

This is a nice point of view only it’s not that high compared to many other things around the world. But what it has going for it. Is the fact that it’s authentic and was built by the king of Denmark, back in the days. So it’s a tower with a lot of history. Also it’s a Journey

Rundetårn is definitely worth a visit, when you get to Copenhagen. It's a lot of fun running up and down the spiral hall, and enjoying the view from the top! The reason it being a 4 star review, is because there is nothing more to see, than the actual view and the enjoyment from
This place was awesome - loved the ramp to walk up to the top. Made the climb easy! Easily accessible right down town - don’t miss this!

One of the most enjoyable things we did in Copenhagen and a definite recommendation. The signage about opening times was a bit misleading as it said open From Thursday to Monday and we wanted to go in on Wednesday. But this could have been for the exhibition. This wasn’t a
Nice small experience. Very nice 360 degrees view from the top. Go especially if you have free entrance by Copenhagen card.
A wide spiral ramp takes you up through the tower to beautiful views of Copenhagen. It's a simple pleasure but fun and is always a joy to visit.

This tower it’s located just in the middle of Copenhagen, just in the end of their famous shopping street. On the top it’s old observatory and also nice view on the city. The best it’s there are no stairs to get up, only uphill - if I remember correctly it’s 7.5 times around to
It worth visiting and the price just perfect to see from the top of the tower. I just love it the interior stairs corridor and will recommend to visit. Interesting also for the history of this tower.

The Round Tower is a great sight to visit. Do not be intimidated by the crowd. You can still take great pictures and not feel overwhelmed. The way to the top is very easy and totally worth it once you are up. Along the way you can check various hidden rooms around the tower.
Lovely walk/climb up the tower. Thankfully no steps, so anyone could manage the climb to the top. Toilets half way up. Copenhagen is great for facilities!! Lol View is stunning from the top.

I really enjoyed climbing the Round Tower and the view that you were rewarded with! The journey to the top consists of a moderately steep spiral that probably takes less than 5 minutes with some stairs at the end. Suitable for children and parents with strollers/buggies. The
Our children enjoyed the long winding road to the top of the tower. Getting to know the story behind the building was very interesting - obviously christian 4th didn’t enjoy walking 😉

Great vantage point if you're looking for some city pictures. The tower looks high but the walk up is not as gruelling as the church in Bruge. ! The way to the top is a spiral slope which makes climbing the tower much easier. Along the way you can stop and rest and visit some
A fantastic tour with a fantastic exhibition in the middle on the way - we came only for the exhibition, but found it really easy to go all the way to the top :-) excellent
Paid just under £3 to see some great views across Copenhagen. Not as high as Saviours Church, but it has a proper viewing deck at the top.

Situated amongst the shops of Copenhagen the Tower provides an opportunity to get a 360 view from above the rooftops, and is a good opportunity for those panoramic shots of the city skyline. It costs about £3 to enter, and the walk up to the top is easy thanks to the not to

I had left this tower till last. I used my COP card to get in so not sure how much it costed. Its a nice wide area to take your time walking up. Stopping to look out of the winds as you go. There is a couple of places you can stop off at. The bell tower with is above the church

The entrance fee was very inexpensive and the building's architecture is wonderful. Other than the central column, the entire tower is one big spiral slope. There's a beautiful view into the attached church (Trinitatis Church) near the bottom of the slope. There's also access
Lovely view of Copenhagen. Easy walk in historic area. This is something no tourist should miss in Copenhagen

The Round Tower is a really interesting place to visit. It’s one of Copenhagen’s best known structures and it does get really busy at certain times. Admission is 25Kr (about £2.80) and the opening times are 10am to 8pm daily 1st May to 30th Sept and 10am to 6pm 1st Oct to £0th

Pay a visit to the tower of Rundetaarn near the mall in Copenhagen. This old tower has access to a great view and as a newer thing an observatory that is open sometimes in the evening. It was built by king Christian the 4th. Go inside and take a look at the city on the way. A
A great tower - the inside gently slopes upwards with some steps at the top. Very manageable and lovely views from the top.

The Rundetarn is definitely worth a visit. The walk up to the top of the tower is fairly easy for most except a very narrow stairway towards the top. If you are tired during the walk up, there are many pockets of resting areas next to the windows.

An excellent place to get a bird's eye view of the city. The interior is entirely sloped (apart from a short flight of stairs to the viewing platform) and it's organic form takes you up gently, passing windows out and features to see en route. These all have informative leaflets
this is a slope rather than stairs until the very top there are a few so it is easy to get to the top.

This is a wonderful historic tower. The circular walk to the top will definitely work your quads, so do be prepared for the climb. Our favourite part of this was actually the art gallery on the second "level" so don't forget to pop inside!

We went to see this site even though it was pouring rain. Surprisingly this was a good activity in the wet & it was an easy walk to the top since there isn't many stairs. And you get a great view of Copenhagen CBD. If you have some spare time make the effort to visit.

The architecture and history of the Round Tower make it a worthwhile stop when on a walking tour of Copenhagen. The tower is made of brick and spirals up around a hollow core. There are several interesting stops as you make seven and a half revolutions on the way to the top
Great views of the city and cheap entry (25DKK or free with Copenhagen card) - what else do you need to know?

Cant believe i did this. 36m high but spectacular views from the viewing ledge. Very popular attraction. 25Dkk per person. £3 each. It's a novel way of getting up there round a spiral walkway....the only stairs are right at the top and not too many. Give it a go. Well worth

The circular nature of this building is a novelty and it makes the climb to the top a gentle walk with nice views across the city on the way up. Just be careful as the last little bit is via a very narrow stair case and this can be difficult to navigate if you are prone to

The round tower is in the middle of Copenhagen, not too expensive (25 dkk a person I believe) and you have an amazing view, as well as the fact that you get some insight in the danish history due to the exhibition area. In the top is a planetarium that is really cool as well.

As expected, a great view from the top. On the way up you can stop off at an art exhibition and the obligatory shop (couldn’t resist buying a pencil with a gold crown in the top). Fab little alcoves on the way up and at one stop you can look through a glass floor with a view
In the tower there was a temporary exhibition of amazing pictures, the tower itself is not that spectacular but on a sunny day it can give you a nice view over the city. Relatively cheap to visit

Soaring more than 110' above the streets of Copenhagen, the almost 400 years old Rundetarn is a fun way to learn about the city and see its sights from above. The angle of the ramp is not steep and rather easy to ascend. The numerous windows allow you to look over Copenhagen

Entry isn’t expensive and it only takes 10 mins to get to the top of the tower. There’s an art gallery half way up if you need a break (and to warm up if you’re visiting during a cold season). The views get better as you head up. The last part is quite a few steep stairs so
Interesting design with superb gallery housed within the circular building. A need to visit venue to check out the way the structure was so well constructed.
This towere is definitely worth a visit as it gives you great views over the city and the best part is there are no stairs in it, its just a ramp all the way to the top

I somewhat knew what to expect and well, it was what I expected..The view is lovely from the top to but it isnt easy to get up and down the stairs when everyone else is trying to at the same time so if you plan to visit keep that in mind, also if like us you have had a busy day

Beside the undisputable historic and architectural value of the Tower, I do value this place as a must see if there is time for it. It is a place that has a really great view from above of Copenhagen, it is an observatory place and it is used as astronomical observation place,

The tower is looks really nice. The circular ramp goes up fully.. And after you reach the top the view is just mind-blowing.... It's free through Copenhagen card.. There is a hollow column inside.. You must stand on the glass of that hollow column...
Nice little extra place to visit whilst in the city!..and not too expensive either like most other tourist attractions! Impressive views across Copenhagen when up at the top!

This was a cheap and interesting way to look over Copenhagen. It was about £3 and you walk around a spiral ramp before you get to the top where the old observatory is. Really worthwhile and an easy way to get to a high spot.
Worth a visit! 25kr per person (adult). Easy to walk up due to no stairs! Views are great on a clear day!

What a beautiful both inside and out. Entry 25 Krona for adult, 5 for child. There is a sloping ramp taking you 7 and a half times around the building to the stairs taking you to the top. There is a narrow spiral staircase (short) to take you to the viewing platform. En route

Archimedes screw in the middle of Copenhagen . i had too see this one . a "round "tower that encompasses 7.5 turns ( like a cork screw ) straight to the top some plus some stairs to take you outside to the viewing gallery . easy walk and different Well worth it

2nd visit and still fabulous. What an amazing site. Take a steady walk up the ramp to the top. There are no stairs until the top as horses were ridden up 😁. Just a great high rise view of Copenhagen from the top of an historic city observatory. Best of all it’s surrounded by
Beautifully maintained building, with great views of Copenhagen. Don't forget the little chamber (half-way up ((ish)) that allows you to see through a glass floor down the inside of the tower.

Really worth walking up this tower. is 25DKK entry and altho a good few floors up, the sloped way makes it much easier. Fantastic views across the city, and the tower is so central you'd be foolish not to go up :)

Walked passed it so many times, but went in this time. Kind of surpriced by the ticket price, 25dkk for adult, 5dkk (!) for the 15yr old - in a good way! Everything so "clean" and nice, the way up, the gallery midway - and then the view, even on the rainy day, beatiful!
Without doubt this was my favourite place in all of Copenhagen. Absolutely stunning inside and a fantastic view from the top.

The tower is a modest climb, but the 360 view at the top is worth it. You are well above most of old Copenhagen. We were there on a sunny day and could see Sweden across the water. There is plenty room at the top. The gallery on the way up was a worthy stop as well.

You will have seen this in everybody's photos - and it's pretty much what you expect. Nice experience to walk up with some interesting information as you go. It was a cloudy day so our view wasn't amazing but I can imagine it being great on a nice day. The gallery half way up
When the weather is good then it's will be a good time for a visit Rundetårn a lot of history from this old tower, and the weiw from the top is great u can see most of Copenhagen.

Good experience, the oldest Observatory that is still functional in Europe. This would probably not be for someone who has limited mobility (leg or back problems) but it is interesting and it's true- it's straight up to the top, no stairs- until you get to the top, to see the
Enjoyed the walk to the top, took it slow though!! Interesting art exhibition on way up. Wonderful views of the city and great opportunity for some photos, recommended.
Great views of the city from the top especially good on a cold clear day you can see for miles across the city rooftops and not that expensive

The Round Tower was built in 17th century as astronomical observatory to continue Tycho Brahe’s research. There are no stairs, but you walk up the spiral walk about 270 m long to get to the top. From the top you get a nice view of the old Copenhagen. Near the library there is an
Strolling along the pedestrian shopping zone, go up if you like. but if you really look for a great panorama, climb the for frelsers kirke.
We visited the round tower which is really quite cool and it is joined onto a church. Quite a hike to get to the top but it is a nice view once you are there.

It's an interesting tower to climb as it has no steps. There is a room which hosts exhibitions. There are some information boards on the way up (or down). At the top, you get a good view on the city. It's totally worth the price!
A nice place to visit with good views of Copenhagen. The glass floor in the middle of the tower is terrifying, but a good feature nonetheless.

We entered with our Copenhagen cards. Very nice visit quick visit to the top of the tower. Not for the faint hearted as there is no lift! Lovely exhibition space which could easily be used for talks and parties. Would recommend not going on a windy day! Picture is view from top
You don't need to worry about the endless stairs to climb up for a good view in this tower. There's no stairs. Just a smooth curved pathway to go up. Only a few stair steps on the very top end.
Nice place to view city from the top and make some pictures. But better if you visit it in nice weather.
We used our Copenhagen cards here, walk up the windy path to the top of the tower. You will then climb the steps to get a full panoramic view of the city.
The spiraling climb upto the rooftop, the narrow stairs to reach the astronomical telescope, the city scape view from top, the gift shop & cafe... we loved it all.

Bang in the city centre and only 2.50 Krona as far as I can remember to walk to the top of the tower for fantastic views over Copenhagen and beyond. Interesting building in it’s own right. No steps but a winding ramp big enough to take a car....
Follow the round walkway to the top for the beautiful scenery of the city. Many photo opportunities.Lots of history plus a gift shop
All should visit this place you can understand how the government maintain the old structure which mingles with the new development.

This was one of my favourite places in Copenhagen. It's beautiful, and walking up the spiral ramp was so much fun. It was very informative and loved to see everything they've preserved. Even the view from the top of the tower was fantastic.

The building itself is really beautiful and the history interesting. An easy walk to the top, which is great for someone like me who doesn't like heights, but it felt like a stroll. What is best though is the surrounding area too, the shops and library all fantastic to look at

Interesting Tower to climb with a spiral walkway all the way to the top which has great views over Copenhagen. There was a jewellery exhibition on half way up that had some lovely pieces on display. Small fee for entry but worth it to see the novel tower and views

This is a must do activity whether winter or summer - take time to read the history of this building, walk up to the top... you might need a wee break to catch your breath along the way, but the views from the top are beautiful you see Copenhagen spread out all below you, it
Very inexpensive visit. Good to learn the history and great views over the city. Would highly recommend

This round tour was a surprise as had expected hundreds of steps all the way up, but instead there was a moderate slope all the way to the top with little interesting side rooms all the way up - such as a glass floored observation room, the observatory right at the top.

Defiantly worth a trip to the tower, entry is included in the Copenhagen card and the towers opens about 10am each day. The access is easy as the tower just spirals upwards with just a few steps at the very top to get to the viewing platform. The views over the city are

A large round tower in Copenhagen city centre, small entry fee. Walk to the top the sloped floor takes you up a bit like walking up a helter skelter then a few steps takes you to the top for great views across the city. Worth a visit.
Superb feat of engineering, quite a hike to the top but well worth it for the view. Lovely coffee lounge near the top so you can take a break

I have visited the round tower quite a few times and I always love it. The entrance fee is very reasonable (40dkk) and you can easily spend an hour or more there. The church attached to it can be seen trough a big glass window, and there is usually some kind of execution in the

When King Christian IV build this tower he did not imagine how popular it would become some 300-400 later or even before. King Christian IV was an observant christian and believer, that he also put G-d's name on (in gold) in Hebrew almost at the top of tower on outer wall. The
fantastic panorama in Copenhagen. It is worth visiting a spiral staircase to the top of the tower. Very special

Impressive tower! A long walk up, but worth it. The details are amazing, and the old carved signatures in the windows are interesting. Fun to imagine that people used to ride horses up the tower. The art exhibition was interesting.
Amazing ascent - no stairs just walk round and round. Views for miles at the top and just breathtakingly pretty

This is a tower to go up and see the view from the top but it does not have stairs you just walk up a gentle slope made from cobbles inside a tower there are also Loos and a museum inside the roof of the building it is joined to which happens to be a church. This is such great
Nice and fast tour to one of the highest buildings of Copenhagen. Tremendous view and a cosy small exhibition at the last floor

This is a wonderful gem of a place and a visit is a must! A Beautiful gradual slope takes you almost to the summit (if you want an easier walk, stay to the outer side as opposed the the inner) there are window / stops to look out at the view. Once the slopes end there are some
The Round tower Rundetaarn was built by king Christian as a telescope On top you have a beautiful view of Copenhagen
One of my favorite places in Copenhagen, you get a good overview of the city and get to enjoy the lovely old buildings
The round tower starts with a gently sloping spiral and leads to steeper stairs but rewards with a good vista. There was an exhibition of Jewel's when we visited at the halfway mark.
Looks nice, really cool architecture, but was so big a queue I didn't go in which is a big shame... not sure if you can buy tickets in advance, but if so, do it!

As it comes from the name the round Tower is what to see, we had a short stop infront of it during our tour, unfortunately we did not have a visit inside but we learned it is coming from the 17th century and was built as an astronomical observatory, so this little information

Yes, it is cheap and has good view once on top. But no information about the building, when built, what used for, why there is a ramp, etc. Had to look it all up on internet. So realize you are just paying to go up to top of tower.

I don't have much to add to what people have already said, which is that it's an inexpensive and fun thing to do. Only a few steps to climb, but mostly a manageable and steady incline, with toilet halfway up, and a lovely view when you reach the peak.

So this place is very well known to Danish people and build by Christian the 4th and is one of the highest buildings in Copenhagen. This gives a fantastic view of the City. Its spectacular because there is no stairs expect at the very top. The church Trinitatis is part of the

I was here in August of 2006. The way to get to the top of the Round Tower is up a spiral set of stairs in this almost Medieval type building, which seem to go on forever. It's really nice once at the top, as the views are really good. Plus, it's good exercise.
Visited with my partner and 14 year old daughter this tower is well worth the visit . Entry is 25K for adults and 5 k for children . Fantastic views from the top of the tower of the city .

Kids cost almost nothing to get in, and you get a great walk inside the tower for all ages, the view is fantastic, and you get 30 minutes of from the busy crowd. And all kids can go to clean toilets before you explore the rest of Copenhagen.
Copenhagen is totally flat. So this tower gives you the opportunity to see the city from above. It’s easy to go up there!
We came up here at sunset and the views were amazing! Definitely worth a visit. The staircase right at the top is quite narrow, but it’s not too long!
A must do in Copenhagen. Located very centrally. Walk up to the floor is on a sloped floor and not too challenging. View from the top is stunning!
Brilliant view from the top and a nice walk up. You can see 369 degrees from the top you can walk all around. Not much fir the admittance fee.

The ascend is defined by a stair-less spiral and rewards you with the most beautiful views on the capital! Go for sunset or after - when ou can use the oldest European observatory to gaze into the stars, too! For that little money absolutely worth it
The round tower is a great place to visit, it isn't expensive and the views are stunning. We arrived in time for sunset which was incredible. But be prepared to walk up a slope to the top.

This is a 17th century round lookout tower and you get to take in a panoramic view of the city when you reach the top! It only costs DKK 25 / £3 to go inside and the climb is very gentle so you don’t need to be super fit.
the rundetårn in Copenhagen has an amazing view, it is cheap to go up. and when you are in the top you have a great view of Copenhagen,

Visited with a bit of skepticism about the beauty of this place and instead we had to reconsider. Accomplice a beautiful sunset, from the top you can admire an exceptional panorama of Copenhagen. I recommend buying the Copenhagen Card on arrival in the city because this monument
We had a great walk to the top of this very cool tower. The view from the top was amazing. This is a cheap activity to do, only about £2-3. There is also a great hotdog place Dop outside.
Arrive early in the day, as the queues are long & move quite slowly. Oddly, the view from the top is the same as the view from Magasin 5th floor bathroom! Still worth it.

The old privy, the planetarium, the spiral staircase, the rooftop are just a few things one could see when visiting the Rundetaarn. There was a beautiful exhibition of jewelry artworks half way to the top, which was an even more important space than ever as you could warm up
Very central to get to, it’s an easy walk to the top, mostly up a graded ramp with steps near the top. Good views.

We by chance decided to ascend up to the tower after a coffee in nearby Studenterhuset (which we recommend for a relaxed atmosphere). Certainly worth the 50kr for the views alone for the 2 of us, if you go on a Tuesday or Wednesday on evening we discovered you can also get in
This was one of the highlights of our visit, well worth the entrance fee for the historical significance, view and coffee!
it is only 25Kr to pay, walking to the top is easy and it is a good cover in a rainy day. The view from the top is absolutely beautiful. It is a great activity for families with small children.
We walked to the top with our kids. We were too early for the astronomy exhibit on a Wednesday night and it was cloudy anyway but seemed like this would have been interesting. On Copenhagen Card.
There is a small fee to enter this attraction, but when you reach the top, the view will compensate you! On the way up, there is an exhibition room and a cafe room, to cover the visitors' needs.

High-rise buildings are few and far between in Copenhagen, so the Rundetaarn gives you one of the few publicly available views over the city skyline. The history of the facility as an early astronomical observatory is also interesting to those with scientific curiosity.

We love getting to the top of towers to see across the city and this one was excellent! So easy as it's just a gentle slope all the way up to the top - if only all towers were made this way!! There are plenty of windows on the way to watch the city as you head up higher and a

If you can manage 210 metres of continuously winding uphill ramp , this is worth the effort for the view you get from the top ( 35m above street level ) for DKR 25 ( around £2.20 ). Keep to the outer edge of the spiral : the going is easier as the gradient is only 1 in 10 , but
There isn't much to do here beside take pictures. Wish they incorporated more about the astronomy connection because otherwise it's just a tower.The church next door is beautiful.
This is by far the best value tourist attraction in central Copenhagen. We loved walking up the tower and the views from the top are unparalleled.
If you are not fit don't do it a hard walk to the top great view when you get there I enjoyed it I used the chc card for my stay a bit pricey if you just pay on the door
