We visited after pm on a Tuesday night to visit the observatory on top of the tower. It is quite easy to ascend the tower as there are no steps but a ramp all the way up. At the top is a viewing platform and then a few steps up to the observatory and telescope.We arrived with

First, I loved that to get to the top it was a ramp instead of a tiny spiral staircase (though there is a tiny spiral staircase at the very top - only about 20 steps). The view from the windows going up were wonderful, and there were a few places to stop along the way. There was

We visited this tower after visiting a few of the other key towers and this was the best of the lot. It's cheap to enter and offers a rather cool way up, instead of steps it is just a rounded slope. The view from the top was also surprisingly impressive, i could see over to the

This tower I feel is under rated I was told to go on a clear day and they were right the view was amazing you can see Sweden and the bridge to join Copenhagen and Sweden. It was like being at the top of the Eifle Tower, lovely fresh crisp air, this is clarity to me!Totally

Do you want to see Copenhagen’s beautiful surroundings and roof tops? Well, then go to see Runde Tårn. Walk the spiral to the top and enjoy the magnificent 360 degrees view of the city. The spiral walk way was originally designed so that the king’s horses could pull his wagon
it is a very nice waking all round up, the view fron the top was great and to all direction. Don't miss to try get in the center of point zero
Lovely views and easy walk to the top. Highly recommended. We went in the evening and the city with the Cristmas lights was so beautiful.

Nothing to add from other travellers about the unique nature of the spiral ascent, impeccably maintained and with the additional spice of the glass floor view straight down the middle of the tower into the inky depths. From the top one can really appreciate how well the Danes

80dkk (just over €10) for our family of 4 to check out the tower. It was unique because it wasn’t a spiral staircase like most towers. Observation deck gave a 360 view of Copenhagen. Toilets available on two different levels (one with a great view). One room talks about the

Visited here around 2 in the afternoon and theres no much visitors that time. Paid 20dkk if am not mistaken. The road going up is not stairs but its a brick of stones made to be a way for the horse of king christian IV coz he dont wanna walk and climb up to the tower. So

A really unusual tower with a cobblestone pathway circling to the top. Even fine for pushing a pram up to the top. We saw two people doing this. Great views from top.

Do not miss this. Absolutely loved it, a beautiful space inside as you walk up through the cobbled tunnel type building and upto the top where you can see for miles in all directions above Copenhagen. An absolute must to visit.
Fantastic view and mind boggling craftmanship. Look also at the churc that is attached yo the tower.

Easier to access than the church of our saviour as it’s a ramp up most of the way. At the end there are two small flights of stairs and one steep staircase. There is also much more space on the viewing platform so you feel you can make the most of your time up there without
We didn't go in, but from the outside looks very cool. We thought it was a bit expensive to go inside.

We had the copenhagen card so went here on one of the yucky weather days. Its cool to walk up to the top and to see the city from that perspective.
The round tower worth a visit very reasonable, the views are amazing you can see for miles. Great way to get your bearings of the city.
If you are already in city center and goes by Rundetaarn, take those steps to the roof to get picture of Copenhagen. Not sure about the entry price as we had Copenhagen Card.
google: Awesome ancient tower with impressive roundabout way up. Great views over central Copenhagen from top.
This place is great! I didn’t see this included in enough travel blogger posts, but this is a cant miss stop in Copenhagen. The views are amazing and it’s only about $3 to get in!

Nice and fun little historical (church)tower in the middle of city centre shopping district, with an old astronomical observatory on the top. An exhibition room and regular events. Nice view from the top.

Awesome experience. There are no stairs to climb until right near the top, so it isn't too challenging. Great view over Copenhagen and a really cool old telescope at the top of the tower. All together we took about an hour to complete this attraction.

This is one of the top 10 attractions of Copenhagen. Going up to the top of the tower is already a cool experience. The view is great. Toilet and coffee shop are available in the tower. Highly recomended. The entrance fee is around 4€.

Without a doubt the best tower i have ever been up. GOOD SELECTION OF ANIMAL STAMPS. All together a satisfactory tower experience
Nice historical round tower with beautiful view of Copenhagen. You can even see the bridge to Malmö from there!
Very nice views of Copenhagen from the top of the tower. Plenty of photo ops. Building architecture is very interesting. Brick flooring with old windows. The art museum in this building is also fun
Curious ancient royal building in Copenhagen without stairs. Beautiful view of the whole city from the top.

The round tower - if you want to see a view of Copenhagen from high up this place is the place to go. The top of the tower is beautiful with a 360 view of the city. There are not many stairs instead a slope to walk up and then a few stairs …

Not expensive, part of the city’s cultural identity . Built so the king could take his horse to the top makes this spot worth the effort.
It is a struggle if you’re not fit but you can take your time. Don’t forget to look down the well on …

Super cool site.  Don't miss the placards in some of the windows telling animal stories about the tower.  Also towards the top there is a small window showing the 30m tall hollow core of the tower; don't miss looking down this!

I watched sunset in the top of the Round Tower. It was amazing. I think no word can describe the beauty of Copenhagen at that time. Thus, I won't write long. Only say to you that: Come and Enjoy by yourself!

Very nice tower without almost any stairs. If you hate walking stairs but want to see some nice views of Copenhagen, this is your place. It was very windy when we were there. Careful about your belongings and hats, phones, bags or anything …

Great place to visit one of your first days in Copenhagen because you get a nice view from the top. Also very nice walk up the spiral tower with many historical notes and a small exhibition. Went first thing in the morning and it wasn’t too crowded, nice to walk up without too many visitors.
Nice landmark of copenhagen.
Gorgeous view at the top looking out over all of Copenhagen. Not very accessible even though it is mostly a giant ramp. There are stairs of the last few levels.
Worthwhile trip for just 25DKK. The views are stunning from the top and, if your cool with PDAs, you can always take advantage of the kissing seat just before you go up ;)

This place wasn’t on our list of places to see by any means and we only decided to go in because we were getting coffee nearby. 

I actually really liked it - both the internal design of the tower and the museum/exhibits that were at the …
The tower had some amazing views from the top you could see right across the city. The observatory and the walk up the tower were fantastic.
Quite a walk up the tower but the views over the city are worth it. Nice hot chocolate stand at the bottom as a reward. 😋

Definitely worth a visit while your in Copenhagen. It's very cheap to go in, there are interesting things to see as you make your way to the top, and the view is amazing. Be sure to stand on the glass floor  in the middle, about 3/4 the way up!

I would recommend going there shortly before sunset because then the view is great and good for some pictures. On the way up there are some rooms which you can enter and see some other small attractions. Also be aware that if it is slightly cold and windy that it is super cold and windy at the top.

It is a wonderful place in the middle of the town. A must visit if you want to get a full view of the city.
I never imagined something like this could be located in the middle of the heart of the city.
There are few congested stairs in the …

The ticket cost 25krn and the kids can get a discount and pay only 5krn. The view from the top is stunning, you can see all the city. The view to get to the top is unusual because there are no stairs. I recommend it.
Really cool architecture for a place this old and very reasonable entry price. Definitely worth visiting
The way up the top of the tower is long spiral and not a staircase. From the top you have interesting views over the city. Entrance fee is reasonable so it is Wörth a try.
really nice attraction. you can see the whole city and it only costs about £3. it's a nice insight into some of the history of the city

Nice little but of Copenhagen history with some sights at the top. Unfortunately the weather was rubbish and couldn't see too far out. Walk up took about 5 minutes approx? At the top there is quite a narrow spiral staircase. Not much else to it. 50DKK for 2 adults.

One of the best views in Copenhagen. No stairs but steps till the very top but fairly steep helical floors to reach it. Small observatory at the summit and a glass panel near the top you can look down the hollow central column.

Very cool! The spiral ramp is truly neat. Lots of interesting history to absorb. Loved the observatory at the top as well.

Great way to get a view of the entire city right in the heart of it. Really fascinating architecture and way of climbing the tower makes it worth the entry fee. It is only a tower though don't expect much more
Very cheap. Fun walk up to the top. Best view of the city centre. Exhibition space was also a great unexpected addition to the visit.

For the affordable price of 25 dkk it's possible to go up at the top of the tower and gave a look around at the city. The view from up there is stunning, no doubt about that, mostly because the city is quite low grounded and from up there …
It's stunning to look over the spiral area from the glass floor near the top of the tower!

Neat place with a great view of the city from the observation deck.
There was an exhibition with a space theme when we were there.

There are a fiew nice surprises on different floor. Well worth the visit.
Fun and cheap, the view from up top is not the main attraction. Just don't let your kids rub against the walls or they will be covered in white chalk.

Fabulous views of the city from the top, and two nights a week (if its clear) you can gaze through the telescope at the heavens as it's manned by volunteers.
The climb to the top up the ramp is suprisingly easy. There are toilets near the top and also a cafe.

Charcteristical building of Copenhagen old town. A completely round tower with a 10% of lean coefficient 😂 a never-ending experience, with lots of room filled with memories of the tower's history when was an observatory. You can grab a good eyesight of Copenhagen skyline from its rooftop. Must see👌🤗
Amazing place in the middle of the city! If you go on wednesdays at least, its oprlen until 9 p.m. enabling you to have a look trough the old telescope! Affordable entrance fee too!

I never thought that you can have So much fun in historical place like that. I really enjoyed walking up all the Way by spiral floor, not by stairs. Something you don't see too often. 😀
View from the top was also good, as well as …
Great feeling to see how cities are built over the history that people still enjoy.
If you're looking for a 360° view of Copenhagen, this is the place you have to be. Burn those calories and climb you way to the top and enjoy the view. You can also see Sweden from this height.
A delightful experience. After a walk up the circular slope, you are welcomed with a 360°view of Copenhagen. Inside you can also see the bell tower.

Great and unusual building. Even Sweden can be seen from the top of the tower. Besides there is an observatory on the very top, but it's opening hours are between 6 and 9 pm. Visiting the observatory is included in standart admission.
Old tower with magnificent views of the city of Copenhagen.. you can plan your itinerary here.. also those looking for some elevation training can climb the tower 3-4 times..
The most fun I have had climbing to the top of the tower as there are no stairs only flat incline!

This is centrally located with lots of other things to do around it. It's nice to pop in and check it out. It didn't take long to go up and the views are pretty nice of the city. There might be an exhibit on one's of the other floors as well so it's not just a up/views/down experience.
Lots of history. Good walk to the top. Nice view. Low entrance fee.
Good place to know but about Copenhagen history, you can also see old Copenhagen view from the top of the tower.

Cheap to get in, a small, simple attraction, but boasts great views over the city. Some interesting things to see inside also, each of which has an accompanying leaflet fill of information to put everything into context.

Unique, historical building in the center of a beautiful downtown Copenhagen!
Interesting way to top, historical, nice views. Defenitely worth the money.
Spiral walk to the top, which has a rooftop that gives you a decent view of the city.

Great view of Copenhagen. If you are in the area I would recommend seeing it 
 25 DKK entry which is fair.
Beautiful building, funny wee toilet, great views of the city! And admission prices are really good.
Wonderful place, filled with history.
Very cheap entry, nice views and an ascent like no other tower I've ever visited.

The view from the top is not that great. There are bars everywhere which ruins the view. For a much better view, go to Church of our Savior. Entry is cheap at 25 kr and it's a 5 min walk from Nørreport. The hotdog truck 100 m left of this place is good though.
Great view and such a different monument also free with the copenhagen card!
Beautiful place but you have to pay to get in.

A great place to visit! Architecturally super-cool in it self, it also offers the best view of Copenhagen and beyond. I am a local and visit once a year. It doesn't get old..

A nice place for a short trip in copenhagen. There is a beautiful view over Copenhagen from the top . The entrance is cheap and in the middle of the tower is a small studio with art exhibitions. If you are in town and have some time to …

Family friendly great for kids. Stamping activity to learn about the various round towers still in existence. Interesting architecture. Good to do this activity on a rainy day. Most of the walk up the tower is indoors.
This is very cool. Probably my favorite find in Copenhagen.
Nice view, great place to get out of the weather.
Nice place with well-designed guide. There are several exhibitions in the tower, and visitors can overlook the scenery at the top. Entrance fee is 25 DKK.
Fantastic Copenhagen viewpoint but be ready for a long and hard walk up the spiral route up to top of tower

Cool landmark with great view of the city. There was an exhibit on quilted art that I found really neat. Nice side displays that were interesting and informative. Worth the price but was quite busy when I went.

Once you reach the top, the views over Copenhagen are lovely! This is a nice quick attraction that you can do in under an hour if pressed for time.
A good place to see Copenhagen from up above at minimal price!
Extraordinarily tower with a nice view to Copenhagen city. Impressive architecture inside.
If you're interested in history this place is one of the "go to" when in Copenhagen.
So much to see and do.  Just the ramp walk to the top will be enough for some.  There is a lot to experience and explore here.  Best tourist value in the city. Bring a real camera.
Great experience and not scary at all. You'll have the best view of Copenhagen on the top.

Really good views of the city. There is no lift so you do have to walk all the way up yourself and it’s quite a track but there are stops along the way; small rooms with museum like things inside. Mostly space themed.
Beautiful and unique location. We get a really good view of Copenhagen when it's not cloudy :)
Absolutely worth a visit, great view over Copenhagen
It was really special since there were no stairs, I really liked the idea

It's unique architecture makes it a worthwhile visit if you are talking a walk around the city - you'll also get a great view of the city itself from the roof area and there can be an art exhibition in one of the rooms also.
Relatively cheap, great view from the top and a nice unexpected section in the middle
Costs around 5 euros to visit. I would say the Towers ist just for people who Love to see arial view of old city.
Effortless walk to the top, you are rewarded with the best views of the city. It's worth doing!
Great views of Copenhagen. Exhibition also included.

If you hate climbing stairs but want to enjoy the beautiful view, than this is the place to go!
Admission is not very high, but we had Copenhagen card, so it was free for us. I visited it with my mom (she is 60) and it was no problem for …

For 25 dkk this is a fantastic spot! Great views of the city, nice exhibit (I saw the moon one in Oct 19'), a bit of history. I wish the astronomy part was open when I was there, I imagine checking that telescope out should be fun. A must see!

This was a great place to visit. Art galleries on various floors, a fun walk up a spiral ramp to stairs the last bit of the climb. The view was spectacular! We would totally recommend a visit to the Round Tower! Near the top is an opening …

Cheap entrance to an interesting historic tower. It's sloped, rather than stepped so carts could be used to bring books up to the library and astronomical equipment to the top. It also means you can take a buggy almost to the top!
Very nice place to visit. Definitely worth to climb the top, view to whole city is amazing!

An intresting tower.
The entry is 24 DKK for adults

The Round Tower known locally as Rundetaarn dates all the way back to 1642 and is the oldest functioning observatory in Europe. You can find the tower is in the Latin Quarter and is a fascinating tower (due to its unique cobbled spiral walkway) with nice views from the top.

It it one of those places, you need to go, just to tick it off your list, when you are in Copenhagen. The tower has an interesting story, and there is a good view over the city. It used to be free to visit the tower. However, now you have …
Interesting building with panoramic city views.
Great view, especially during sunny day, however there should be some order between going up and going down the stairs at the top of the tower
It's quite central to town and gives you a good idea of the layout and surroundings. Kids loved the little alcoves and the glass shaft in the centre.

An awesome way to view the gorgeous Copenhagen skyline. It's not that expensive and is a must do if the weather is good especially since the tower has quite some history. Overall it's an amazing experience for all ages to enjoy.
A really unique experience, though a little dizzying!!! With all the exhibits within the building, this is well worth the admission price.

Excellent place to visit. Fun for kids and adults to run up the wide spiral walkway to the top. And the views at the top are great too. Often there are art exhibitions in the halls off the side of the main tower and also the telescope in the observatory is sometimes open to peek through. Best value entry in Copenhagen in my view.
Good view from the top though not much else to do. Climb was easy enough although is at an incline as opposed to stairs.

Round and round you go. All the way to the top and squeeze passed other tourists on the kissing stairs.getting to the top is no mean feat so be prepared for a trek! Great views from the top of the entire city.
A great place to see the city from above, cheap entry and a long but fun swirly walk up
Quier wierd tower, nice view. It is nice place ro visit.

Fun climb for a great view!  Most of the 7.5 turns are wide -- the king wanted to be able to ride his horse up nearly to the top.  There are plenty of window seats for the weary, and stops for gifts and toilets.  Toward the top there is a …
An historic building from where you see the top view of Copenhagen. Should visit if you are exploring Copenhagen. Worth to visit.

The panorama on the rooftop is definitely worth climbing up a sloped ramp. Also, there are small museum about the library, observatory and the church here. The observatory where Tycho Brage worked is closed which is weird. However, entrance fee is a bit expensive taking into consideration it is just a rooftop and small museum.
Visited with copenhagen card. View was nice and the interior of the tower is unique with its inclining slope instead of stairs. Would recommend.
This is a fun place to visit. It is an easy time to the top with stops at a rotating exhibition and restroom breaks. Go at sunset to see a great view of the city.
Hope you love walking up an incline!!! It's well worth it. The view is so nice with 360° view of the city.
Fantastic view on all of the Copenhagen. And cheap one as well. Totally worth the money and the climb.
Great history here! I love how it looks from the outside. There was an art gallery inside full of interesting pieces
Amazing views of the city. You can even see Malmö and the Øresund bridge from up there.
Good place to see whole Copenhagen from the top
Nice place, I found it quite normal price for Danish standards

It's not too hard to get to the top, but you pay 25DKK for the privilege of that exercise. The view from the top is  good at night, especially with Christmas decorations on in the city. But it won't take your breath away. You won't be able spend mor than 15 minutes at the top. F
Very attractive tourist spots in Copenhagen.. Must visit
Loved this place, definitely a must visit when in the area. The view from the top is spectacular! Entry fees are also very affordable.

Its a nice vacation workout to walk all the way up and its pretty fun. There are random museum spots throughout and the top is amazing. If you want pics of the top of the entire town, this is the place. Amazing
Fun place to take family. It is not that expensive especially if you are large group. They often have some exhibition. And there is always nice view from the top even if the weather is cloudy :-)

I was in Copenhagen for a week and enjoyed everything- it’s not the most amazing thing but if you have 20-30 minutes to kill it’s worth a visit. There was an art exhibit when I had visited and it was fine. The ‘climb’ up is gentle- no steps, just a winding inclined ramp.

Definitely worth a visit and the price was lower than expected compared to most things in Copenhagen. There was an interesting art exhibition half way up too. There's also an observatory at the top but it was closed when I was there.
Amazing birds eye views of the city from the rooftop.
Cheap way to see the skyline of the city.
Nice view over the city. it's a but windy
As far as viewpoints go, not bad. Copenhagen doesn't have great skyline though. You can see the bridge to Malmö, factory and beach area and all parts of the city.  On the way up is cafe and gallery.
Worth the visit! Great views of the city and the church attached is a cool sight
Cute place for people who love astronomy. Great city view from the top of the Tower.
Excellent location. You get a good view of the city given the weather is on your side. There is small entrance fee but definitely worth the visit. Walkable distance from the square centre.
Great experience. Easy on the legs. Fully accessible slart from the last bit.
25k for adults for a towering view over the city. It's sloped most of the way but beware some steep steps at the top, only a few but worth knowing!
Excellent view from above the tower.
Breathtaking views on Copenhagen, and very cool place + there is a toilet and little museum for very low price (25 krones)

What sort of a person builds a ramp up a tower so he can ride his horse up to the top? Crazy Danish Kings had the best ideas. 

This place has amazing views of Copenhagen. Not a hard climb. Worth it.

The interior of the tower  has been turned into a wonderful space for people to enjoy. The views from the top need no further platitudes. It was fun to pick out Øresund bridge while viewing Copenhagen and beyond.
Great view over the city. Definitely a must visit although it’s slightly overpriced.
Eagle view of Copenhagen.. loved it
Good view from upstairs, or should i say upramps, cause it's a bit of a climb. But that's pretty much it
The Round Tower in the heart of Copenhagen is worth a visit.  Here you can see a 360 degree view of the beautiful Copenhagen.

The 17th tower which is the oldest observatory in Europe. You can see the view of old part Copenhagen at the top after walking up the spiral walk. But not easy to take a good picture because it is surrounded by fence.
Great view from the top. I liked to do something active during my trip to Denmark and walking all the way to the top was one of those things. Also there is a toilet halfway up.
One of my favourite places to visit when in Copenhagen.. such a great view at the top!
If you are in the city center you might as well drop by. You walk inside the tower via a slope and at the end a couple of steep stairs in order to enjoy the view from high up of Copenhagen.
Nice view but not high enough.
Really cool place and once you're at the top, you get a great panoramic view of Copenhagen.
Amazing view! Highly recommended to visit in Copenhagen.
Clean, plenty of clean toilets, seats all the way up. Lovely views from the top. Some very interesting historical facts about round  throughout Europe.
Nice touriste place. The climb is very slow and nice ! Great view from the top
Enjoyed it even if the view was shrouded in torrential rain. The 50 year celebration of the moon landing halfway up was pretty unexpected but really.cool

Worth seeking out, not just as an interesting building but the views from the top give a good perspective of Copenhagen. Watch the small, circular staircase at the top, it needs some sort of traffic light system. Other than that, the ascent is a relatively easy slope, not stairs.
Really nice sight in Copenhagen - cheap, quick and you are not overloaded with information. It is very close to great shopping areas and has a stunning views of the city. Definitely worth a visit
Always a fun destination for the family from Canada...
Cheap tourist attraction to go into. Good if you want a nice panoramic view of the city.

The tower is constructed with a spiral ascend and is unique in Denmark though it has its brothers and sisters all over Europe . The city of Copenhagen can be seen from here and it should be a must for every tourist. A highly recommended …
Such a great experience! It was a such a beautiful view from the top. Don’t miss the Glass bottom enclave and the little rooms that offshoot the main tower, with informational guides and photos.
This is a stylish way to check out the whole of Copenhagen from roof top while experiencing some ancient feel...
Good place to roam around and view  Copenhagen  .Male sure weather  is right
Well worth the visit. Go early to avoid lines. You can see Sweden from the top!

This tower is in the pedestrian street of Copenhagen.You can have a very beautiful over view of while Copenhagen and if the weather is clear so you will have the opportunity to see the tremendous view of Orisund bridge.
Value for money using Copenhagen card
Interesting architecture and nice panorama on the city and beyond.
An interesting structure that inspired many spiral towers like it all over Europe. It also gives you a 360 degree view of the city being one of the tallest structures in the area.
It's a relatively easy walk up the spiral ramp finishing with a few steps on a narrow staircase to the top of the tower where there is a very nice 360 degree view of the city.

Initially we were not too sold on going all the way up this landmark, but I’m glad we did! Very different since right smack in the middle of the city and doesn’t have stairs but a ramp! But it is a lot of fun going up and coming down.
The views, I must say, are majestic and it is well worth the effort.
Recommended.

Great view of Copenhagen from roof top and good stop for people interested in history! Be prepared for a steep ascend to a windy outlook! Great for tourists as this attraction is included in Copenhagen Card and in middle of a mall.

Very interesting tower. Complex architecture. Don't rush up and down the tower just for the view. Take your time. Enjoy the view of course, but also take a look at the exhibitions and the planetarium. there is also a glasswindow in the …
The views are worth it, however, it is better to visit this with day light.

Very interesting round tower, that has no stairs but ramp inside of it. Part of it is used for art exhibit. From top you have great view   on Kopenhagen. On top there is a small shop where you can get ice cream, or juice etc...
Remember to collect a sheet at the bottom so you can stamp it on the way up. Good fun information. The gallery space half way up is interesting too. Best seen at sunset for the viwes.

Nice view from the roof in a Copenhagen streets and interesting building itself. They also had a small art exhibition inside last time I’ve been there. 
There is also an observatory on the top, but you need to check working hours in advance.
Interesting story about a lazy King and a good view from the top. Worth a look.

Must visit in Copenhagen. Firstly it's a great experience to walk up the round tower and enjoy the flair of it. Secondly, at the top you have one of the best views over the whole town. So it's all worth the price!
Super nice tower with unexpected exhibition about the moon. Very nice view of the city on top. Cheap ticket, totally worth it, best value for money in Kopenhagen!
A very nice scientific and historical place. Offers a great view of the city and the museum there has really nice exhibits that explain a lot things about moon.
It's really nice. It also has a good view on top.
Great view of Copenhagen.  The walk spirals up. Not too bad if you stay close to the inside.  You get a 360 degree view.
I really enjoyed the walk to the top, lot of history in this tower, I saw the sunrise and it was stunning.
Its an easy ramp going to the top, bathroom is on the 8th floor so you better run hills if you need to take a dump.

Tower with observation deck on the top (price is 25 DKK). It's not difficult to get to the top - no stairs inside the tower, just curved slope.
Views of Copenhagen are very beautiful - old city center, towers, spires, sea and even Øresund Bridge.
25 Dkr. (3‐4€) Entry for 1 person. Its ok
Made me a bit dizzy. But I liked going down.
An amazing landmark of Danish history, also a great vantage point to see the city from above.
Really interesting to visit. Great view from the top
Great view and not so expensive ! But not extraordinary

Neat vantage point where instead of stairway you get to climb an inclined floor almost to the top of the tower. The tower can fit quite a lot of people at the same time so not much queueing is needed. Terrace at the top allows to take great photos of the Copenhagen city.

Good place to get a view over the old part of town. Easy to get to the top even though there's no lift (elevator). On the way up (down) you may want to have a look in the gallery of color. Have a little break, have a coffee or top up your water bottle, read the pamphlet and let it all sink in.
Walk to the top for a great view of Copenhagen
Great price. Awesome views. Unique building. Worth the visit
Nice experience and great view.
Nice view from the top of the tower. Nice gradual inclined plane that one climbs to go to the top. A much better climbing experience than at the near by  church.
Very historically informative and great photo op at the top!
A nice place to visit to see the city but there are bars so it is a restricted view. There are also toilets
I used to visit twice-thrice a week, the view is refreshing!
£2.85 to see this tower. Great views on a clear day
It took several turns to go to the top of the tower and you could see Copenhagen city from above. In specific time, they provided attraction for people to observe stars.
Amazing views of the city (360) an easy climb
A good historic feature in the Copenhagen city centre. The view at the top is worth the walk! You can also use a Copenhagen Card to get in if you're visiting.

Definitely worth the visit. The tower itself is an outstanding monument but you will get as a bonus the exhibition floor and a fantastic panorama on the city. Note however that the ramp is not going up to the top. If you want to see the panorama you will have to climb stairs so this part cannot be achieved by disabled people.
Very old very special tower, with no stairs, with a coppel layed encline where the horses could pull up equipment to the opservatory on the top" that is now closed" but still interesting to visit.

Good to see the top view of most happening place in Copenhagen.
25dkk is entrance fee...

Really nice view and the little observatory on the top is so nice and charming.
Definitely worth to go on top!!!
Good view. Admission Fee 25 DKK
Good visit, no steps until you get to the top.
Awesome place to know a little about the Danish culture.

I really like this place a lot. When I visited there weren't many people around thankfully. I assume it'd be annoying if it's too full. The price of admission isn't much and there are clean washrooms and even a tiny Cafe with modest prices. …
A very unique tower with almost no steps on the inside. At the top there's an old telescope and you can enjoy a great view of Copenhagen.

Definitely worth going up! The views at the top are awesome and the walk up is very cool too! It's not that expensive and I definitely recommend! There's even abig room halfway up where they have exhibitions!
Nice view. Easy access. It's better when it is shining bright light.
Breathtaking views! Well worth the climb.
Awesome views from upstairs!

Europe's oldest active observatory. Spiral ramp to walk up to get to the top for a nice workout. Fantastic 360 degree view of the city.  Attached to a beautiful (I forget the name) church, and located just off of Strøget.
Great view and easy to climb (almost no stairs). Don't miss the glass floor niche (well hidden) - maybe not super spectacular, but if you're already there...
Great place to see the city!  The admission price is fair and the view on top is amazing!  I didn't realize there was an art gallery as well. Very cool place to spend some time whole in Copenhagen!

I have not been there in long time, and there are many more features of interest that can be seen. Plus they have brochures in English that explain each site. And the view from on top overlooking Copenhagen is great.
Interesting experience going up and great view from the city!
You can see all the city. A spiral way brings you up.
Far better than stirs but keep some good energy to climb these curvy steps. So much when walk down. Enjoy the views.

Walk the spiral ramp and some stairs near the top for a panorama of Copenhagen. I didn't find the city particularly photogenic from this spot but did enjoy the breeze. On the way up is a gift shop, an art installation and a glass platform …
Unusual features.  minimal queue. Nice open climb but tiny enclosed staircase at top 20ft if one doesn't like enclosed space. Worthwhile views from top.

The Round Tower is such a beautiful building with an even more beautiful lookout with great city views from the top. 
Even though it's just a simple "round" building where you basically walk in circles to get to the top (this is more fun …
On the top of the Rundetårn you have a wonderful view over Copenhagen.
Lovely view!!! And nice visit.
Very interesting building. Unique design

Nice place to spend an hour or two. Really cool to walk up the spiral ramp and get a view from the top. There are also a couple rotating exhibit spaces worth seeing. Low entry fee makes it a great value.

It is located in one of the most central streets of the city.The view from the top is beatifull,but the way up can be a bit challenging for older people. There is an interesting museum  included in the ticket,a nice view of the inside of …
Great view over all of Copenhagen. The way up is a slope rather than a staircase.

Nice 360 degrees view of Copenhagen from 35 meters of height.

I was quite lucky because it was a beautiful and clear day. The visibility was great!

It’s also a nice and quick workout getting to the top :)
Nice view of CPH, low price
Lovely view beautifully kept
Definitely a round tower.
Cheap to get up and really nice view. There is a small museum also, but not much more to it.

What makes this viewing tower special is that aside from the very top there are hardly any stairs you need to climb... You go up through a swirly path...also there is plenty of clean bathrooms inside... Entrance is also included in the copenhagen card
It's round.
Lovely tower with great viewing
Awesome views of the centre of Copenhagen and brilliant art pieces
I have been there several times and I always liked it. There was an art exhibition in the tower every time I was there, and the 360° view point at the top is quite nice too!

Recommended to visit this place when going to Kopenhagen. It's a combination of church, observatory and viewpoint. The tower also is stylish from the inside, so worth some pictures inside and also from the city. There is a changing …
Fun walk up and nice views.  A few exhibits on the way up too.
Unusual entrance and way up to the tower. The view at the stop restricted by the bars
A must see for the city
It's a long walk to the top ! Good views over Copenhagen
Very highly recommended. Worth every penny. Not visited anything quite like it and I've been up a lot of urban towers! Don't miss the hollow centre with glass floor. Scary!!!
Beautiful tower worth a visit, as a tourist it’s a great way to see the tower from a birds eye view super historical and some great picture places.

Worth a visit simply for the unusual experience! Plenty of people old and young, all having fun.  

Interesting history behind it, plus there were beautiful city views from the top. A modern art gallery also meets you halfway up, which I loved.

This is a great place to visit, especially in the summertime. The church itself is very pretty and the architecture is historic. Inside, in the summertime, they often have music performance, which I got to experience I can say was pretty and moving.
If it is raining or it has rained please avoid to go up, it is really sloppy even in the clear and sunny day we had. However, the views were worth it.
Old astronomy tower. Great views of the city!
Very particular to walk, nice view of the city!
Fantastic views of Copenhagen. A must see to take Panoramic views of the city.
Interesting architectural design, nice view over the city, an art gallery on top of the church and all this for a couple of crowns. Worth it.

The Round Tower was build  in 1642 by king Christian 4th for his court astronomer Thyge Brahe. It has a unique spiral brick walk without steps leading to the top level.
Many sign tells the story of the tower and the European context.
The top of the towers has a walk giving a beautiful 360 degree view of Copenhagen.
Great View of copenhagen center.

It is an interesting tower and one of the better priced things in Copenhagen. The tower is fairly easy to climb and is mostly a ramp with only a few stairs at the top. Once at the top it has great views over the city.
This is a great place to get a view of the city. Not expensive.  The walk up the spiral ramp is not difficult and could be possible for a wheelchair with a helpful person.
Really round. Take the inside track to get up faster.
Top tier view. Awesome place! Not for the faint of heart because the climb is tough and there is a slightly claustrophobic part to the stairs but not too bad
Must see in Copenhagen, great views from the top.
So different and great views of city.
Cool, historic building with great 360 views of Copenhagen.

A round tower right in the city center of Copenhagen. The price to visit the tower is only 25 kr but it is free of you have the Copenhagen card. In order to arrive at the top there is a slope and just a few steps. Halfway during the climb there is a nice shop with souvenirs. Worth it
Just to be able to say, I was there. Walk up then walk down. Have fun.
Stunning views over Copenhagen 🇩🇰
Cheap tour that gives you a full 360 degree view of Copenhagen.
In circles we run and enjoy this awesome view!
Funny tower, cool history 💞

The unique use of a circular ramp instead of stairs make this a nice climb to the top. There are some stairs on the final climb to the viewpoint, but they're short and doable. Views of Copenhagen are difintely worthwhile.

We enjoyed a quick visit to the round tower, 25krone (approx £3) for adults. There was a lovely big event space room that had a visiting exhibition when we visited (as per pics). There are a tiny set of stairs to get to the viewing platform …
Interesting piece of architecture in the centre of the city, would recommend it
Good experience. The climb is not too bad
This was something I wasn't sure about, but the information and the other exhibits made it worth the hike to the top. The view from there over the city was beautiful.
Excellent viewpoint and interesting architecture for a very reasonable price .
Perfect tower, not difficult to get up
Great place to visit. The spiral staircase is amazing

Very reasonable price for a spectacular view of Copenhagen. Approximately £4 to climb the tower's spiral ramp to the seventh floor. Best climbed on a sunny day. Interesting art gallery halfway up the tower which has interesting exhibitions included in the price of the ticket. Ramp is fairly steep so not great for those less mobile.
Nice view around the city. Getting up might get you a headache make you dizzy. There are no stairs.

The best view in the city! Well worth the walk up, which is fun and easy, albeit a steady incline with stairs at the end.  Take notice of the historical notations along the way and peek in the bell tower.  A great way to orient yourself to the layout of the city once atop the tower.

The entrance fee was very inexpensive and the building's architecture is wonderful. At the very top of the tower there's a small observatory dome with a telescope, accessible by some more steps, but this part is only open 2 days a week, so …
Beautiful views of the city from the top
Some great Danish history, worth a visit.
Affordable beautiful view of the city

A quite unique experience! Firstly, not many know that it was an observatory and not a prison and secondly, that they could use hourses to deliver the goods and tools upstairs due to such a construction! It takes time to get up there but …
Good panorama view.Interesting place to visit and low price(25dkk)
Breathtaking view from the round tower! Amazing
Beautiful view of Copenhagen. Small entry fee and toilets.
Nice view out there from the top...walking the way to top is enjoyable

Very pretty but the fact that you had to pay was a huge bummer. I was in kind of a tight budget, and I should've expected it, but still.

You can observe all Copenhagen from there.

Super cheap and amazing views!! Public library and cute coffee shop are close by. If you have good weather in Copenhagen this is a must for the views! They also have rotating galleries. An art experience and views wrapped up in one for a small price. GO!!
Highly unique place to visit with an interesting exhibit looking at the foundations of the tower. The views from the top are excellent.

What a place, I really recommend this site for a visit if you like old buildings, astronomy and culture.  The building is fantastic with a slipped floor that spirals to the top.  On the day of our visit we met with two role play actors who …
Amazing views. Definitely not for disabled visitors though. A great place to see the city
Nice view, easy to go to the top.

Worth it to pay and climb up the slopes! There's a super narrow staircase at the very top though, which can be scary/ claustrophobic for some. On the bright side, there are only a few steps for that staircase :")
A nice view of Copenhagen and a few limited displays.

As a fan of Tycho Brahe, the astronomer who collected the data proving the Sun is in the center of the solar system, I could not miss this place. Visiting during the winter spectacular. I recommend going on a Tuesday or Wednesday evening in …

Cute little museum/lookout tower and totally worth the low price of admission. Less fun on a rainy day. You walk up this amazing ramp to the top. Kids will live it. Stairs at the top so leave strollers behind. Yes, the tower has bathrooms, and a gift shop. Great views of the city skyline (such as it is) from the top.
Magnificent view from the top of the tower! Must see place in Copenhagen!
Most see this attraction when visit copenhagen
Great for kids. Great history

Walked to the top  great views on a sunny day.

Well worth a visit. There's a ramp all the way to the top which is easy going if you walk round the outside. The stairs at the very top are a bit tight but not too much of a squeeze if someone is walking down at the same tine. Fantastic views!

The round tower has a few surprises in its sleeve. Not only on the summit, but also along the walk: for example the Library Hall - astonishing in its beauty - is now a gallery and a concert venue. A peculiar WC is also on display. Just discover the rest by yourself!
Definitely worth the 15 minutes to walk up and see the view. If you have kids, pick up the map and have the kids stamp it at stations all the way up.

Great tower and very nice view of the whole and greater Copenhagen. It’s even possible to sneak a peak at Mälmo, in Sweden. Just avoid peak hours and check google maps to see how busy it is. Once busy, it is too much of a hassle to get to the top and not much space there to see the view.
Interesting building with a fantastic view over Copenhagen. A bit to walk to the top, but no problem for someone with normal capabilitys.
Nice easy walk up. 25dk. Can Pay on card. Unfortunately the rain and wind came from nowhere at the top so didn't hang around
Beautiful view of Copenhagen from the top of the tower, after you go 12 floors up & around. It's a joy going up.
Nice view from the top. There is a space exhibition midway with a tiny cafe.
Great view from the top

A very interesting tower with an easy access almost to the top. At the very top there is a narrow spiral staircase. It is a great spot to have spectacular 360° view of the city. There are also few exceptions in the rooms on your way up to the top.
A magnificent place with a lot of history and great views across the city from the top! Well worth visiting for the architecture and the lovely climb to the top!

The Round Tower, located in the middle of Copenhagen, was built in the 17th-century by King Christian IV. You can have see Copenhagen from above when standing and sitting at the top of the tower. I used to forget my bag after having an sightseeing on the top of this tower. Fortunately, I came back and my bag was still there :)
A must see. The view from the top is stunning
Great visit for astronomy fans. Proud to climb up the tower
Is a good chirch,i accindentali stuck in a wedding of a completly difrent weding,and is still buetiful,you shuld chek it out.
Great place to visit in a central location of the city.  Be sure to go all the way up.  Don't forget to stop and stand on the glass floor.

Great City Views!

A tower with a difference. Theres some interesting history behind the towers development and reason behind its commission. It adds to what would otherwise be a labouring climb, worth it for the blustery views from the top!
This place is ideal for a superb view.
Just do it. Essential. Go Early in summer to beat the smelling crowds and lines to get up top. Costs about 5 euro

The best view point in Copenhagen. Most fun access to the roof also! Only a few stairs near the top but the rest of it is all slope so gentle climb right to the top then a fun descent down which isn't too steep either way! Public restrooms if needed. And plenty of information in a variety of languages catering to tourists.
Fantastic place to visit. Great views as  you go further up the Tower and don't miss the attached church.

Yes it is a good one for history lovers
Disopinting if you have no interest in history
I don't really get the hype, it is cool to see once maybe but there is nothing that special about it. You want to see Copenhagen from sky? Go to tivoli the star ride.
Great way to spend 30 mins.
Nice tourist attraction with a beautiful view over Copenhagen. Easy to walk up as there are few stairs.
Interesting tower, low price justified as you can finish tour in half hour. Top had nice views from center of city, 360 degrees view.
Worth the price, not expensive (25 DKK for an adult), à temporary exhibition for the 50th birthday of the first step on the moon. Nice view on top of the tower.
Amazing brickwork and tycho history
Only takes 20 minutes. Nice bit of history
Nice view from the top of the tower.

Nicely restored historical building built as an astronomical observatory in 1642. It costs only 25 dkk to go up and you get a great view of the old town from the top.  Brochures with good information are provided in many languages.  A must …

It’s was surprisingly quite large. First you see the church, followed by a museum and exhibits about the inside of the tower followed by unparalleled views of Copenhagen. Absolutely worth a stop and it’s right smack in the middle of the city 🌃

Fun place to visit with unique info. If you want to see the observatory, than you need to check the schedule and go in the night.
Nice view from the rooftop over Copenhagen.

Unique architecture where there are no stairs to reach the top
